text: We visited this nature reserve as part of a birding holiday in The Gambia. We had our own birdguide, Mas Sangeng, arranged by Farakunku Lodges where we were based, however there are guides available to hire at the reserve. Our guide was excellent and we would not have seen half the birds and wildlife without him. The area around the crocodile pool was a bit noisey, some boats were being taken on to the pond and this disturbed any birds there. Green Vervet Monkeys played around the benches and seemed used to visitors. It was further along the pathways we started to encounter the more interesting birds,  Green and Violet Turaco, Western Bluebill and African Paradise Flycatcher to name just a few.  With patience and a good guide the possibilities are endless.  We had no interest in visiting the "zoo" preferring to spend our time looking for birds and we were not disappointed.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Niet veel gezien
text:
Bezocht en doorgelopen. Veel dieren gehoord maar niet gezien tot mijn man de zipper van de rugtas bewoog. Daar waren de apen.
Wij  persoonlijk hadden het liever overgeslagen in onze tour.
Gelopen zonder gids.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Zo gaaf...zoveel apen in een mooi park
text: Super was weliswaar in 2014......Heel goedkoop. Met onze gids de leukste paadjes..zodat we de apen veel zagen

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Better places else where
text:
Pretty poor attraction. As said before, the animals caged at the back of the reserve are poorly maintained and look unhappy.
Go else where!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Ei paljoa nähtävää
text: Odotukset olivat korkeammalla kuin mitä tämä paikka tarjosi. Nähtiin muutamia apinoita ja korppikotkia. Taukopaikalla kerättiin rahaa puistolle, mikä oli toki tapa muissakin nähtävyyksissä. Puiston toisella puolella oli häkissä hyeenoja, papukaija ja jokunen apina, jotka kävivät sääliksi.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A nice walk, but not much else . . .
text:
Situated on the side of the airport road to Serekunda and the beach resorts, the park is easily reached by taxi from most hotels, and is an ideal ‘on your own’ half day out when you have exhausted your tour operators organised trip portfolio.

The self-appointed title ‘Nature Reserve’ does however raise the expectations of the first time visitor, which are unlikely to be met, hence the string of negative reviews.
On arrival, first stop is the ticket hut, where you are relieved of a modest 35 Dalasi each . . . so far so good. You are then directed to an open hut where several ‘guides’ are waiting. We told them we had been before and were happy to go unaccompanied; the reply is ‘snakes sir; lots of snakes . . . if you don’t know where to look, very dangerous’.
The guides were all wearing combat trousers tucked into high laced army boots while I was wearing M&S linen shorts with a pair of Reeboks; I figured they may well have a point.
In an act of extortion that The Peaky Blinders would be proud of, we were instantly relieved of a further 300D, but they had not finished yet . . . ‘you will need binoculars’ they tell us, and whoosh, another 100 changes hands.
What follows is in essence a very nice walk following a well worn path through shady and peaceful woodland, a few birds along the way but nothing you won’t see around your hotel, an army of ants crossing the path, some epic spider’s webs, but not much else.
Next stop is the natural lake containing several hard to spot crocs; you are led up wooden steps to an observation platform which doubles up as a gift shop; another hard sell along the lines of ‘the park runs on donations and what the tourists spend’;  we were in need of a few trinkets for nieces back home, but sadly the variety of gifts was on par with the variety of wildlife, and we escaped wallet intact and empty handed.
Another meandering walk with more of the same; 20 years ago, the path was lined with monkeys, eager to be fed with the bananas that were sold at the entrance; no bananas this time, and no monkeys; there is now a snack stall at the enclosures, and the monkeys learned very quickly that simply hanging around here will keep them well fed with the minimum effort.
They have however become very spiteful and greedy, and will quickly snatch the newly purchased bag of monkey nuts from your hand. The photo opportunities are there, if not a little predictable and staged, and short of a few hyenas in a large pen not much else here to detain you.
Exit is via another walk along another path, and is a different place to your drop-off, but your taxi driver will know this and be waiting for you. A gift shop is at the exit, giving another couple of desperate women one last opportunity to mug you before you disappear forever. The guide then hints heavily that he is not paid and relies on tips; you say I have already paid 300, he says yes but I don’t get that, we part with one final 200 for the guide and find our taxi.
We asked our driver to stop off at Lamin Lodge on the way back for a lunch break; we then detoured back via the pharmacy for a few bits, then the mini market for a few more; all in all, a good half day away from resort, but a nice shady walk only; no more, no less.
Hugely overpriced for what it is; (we spent 670D plus cokes and monkey nuts); better opportunities locally to resort for both monkeys and crocs, and at a fraction of the price.
Don’t expect too much; don’t bother with binoculars, and ditch the guide if you can.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Don't bother coming from the beach resorts
text: I happened to be staying nearby waiting for a flight so spent the morning walking around the reserve. Don't expect to see any wildlife except birds and a couple of monkeys. The animal "orphanage" is really depressing and the guides let a tourist get in the enclosure with two hyenas which makes me think they have no idea how to deal with and treat animals. I only gave two stars because the forest itself is quite nice to walk around and I came with low expectations but I had the opportunity of taking a day trip from one of the beach resorts earlier in my holiday and I'm really glad I didn't

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Absolutely awful
text:
I went there with a friend last week ( 2/12/17)
We went equipped with a book of birds, binoculars, 'ít aint half hot' outfits etc expecting to see wild birds in their natural habitats etc.
There were no birds at all.
 Only a few baboons and a couple of wolves like creatures  in cages and that, as they say, was that.
This is a classic case of a really good bloke who had a dream once that was realised and when it was created and nurtured, it must have been fabulous.
Now, it is a ghost town birdwatching place with no birds but just bumsters having taken over what was once probably something worth seeing.
Don't go.
There is nothing here to see.
The local chancers have taken what's left of a dream over and the place is a shell.
There is nothing to see. 
Really. 

Don't waste your money.
Don't do it.
This is a vacuous dump.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Dubious interest to a casual tourist
text:
I've visited this site several times in search of birds.  Whilst home to many species (some of them very rare) they are not easy to see in the forest, and I'm not convinced that this is a location that a casual tourist would enjoy.  If you do go, make sure you take your insect repellent!

The "animal orphanage" is a central element of most visits, but the conditions under which the animals and birds are kept are really depressing.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Vogelparadijs
text: Erg mooi bos, je kan goed zien hoe divers de natuur kan zijn/is. Veel vogels, vooral bij het krokodillenpoeltje kan je heel lekker kijken. De dieren in de kooitjes vond ik erg triest, ik heb ze bewust overgeslagen.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Déçus !
text:
Nous avions auparavant visité d'autres réserves en Gambie et celle ci nous a déçu.
Nous avions prit un supplément pour avoir un guide et un autre supplément pour louer des jumelles.
Résultats nous n'avons même pas utilisé les jumelles car nous n'avons pas vu d'oiseaux. 
Les seuls animaux que nous avons vu:
Un cobra au loin (juste un d'entre nous l'a vu).
Un crocodile et quelques singes dans les arbres. 

Au milieu de la visite nous avons vu des hyènes et des vautours enfermés dans un enclos...

Il était difficile de comprendre le guide. Pendant la visite il a passé son temps le nez sur son téléphone. 

Points positifs : le lieu est facile à trouver et cela vous fera une balade agréable sous les arbres.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Wonderful forest to walk through
text:
Abuko nature reserve isn’t like the big safari parks.

There isn’t any big wildlife here but there’s plenty other stuff to see and check out.

The walk itself takes about a good hour and it’s best to bring water and avoid the high noon. 
We saw some of the big lizards, monkeys and beautiful spiders. It is said there are some cobra an python snakes as well in the area but you’ll have to be lucky.

Halfway the walk there is this big tree with vultures. Loads of them sitting there. Best not stand underneath them too long...😁

The Hyena’s aren’t there anymore and neither the crocodile. They have been replaced.

As it is with nature parks...you can be really lucky, or really out of luck.

With an entrance fee of 40 dalasi each it’s worth a shot!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Don't waste your time without a knowledgable and private guide
text:
This is a good reserve if you are really interested in exploring the nature and go without any set expectations.  There is no point going there just to tick the box on the places you visited.  You need a proper, experienced and knowledgable guide with you to enjoy this park.  I do not recommend taking "any" guide at the park as most of them are useless.  Also do not go in large groups as you will scare the animals out and will only be able to see the ones in the cage.  You need to have a lot of patience and stamina to walk for at least 90 minutes.  The best time to visit is in the morning when the sun is not heavy on you.  We went during the rainy season so it was a different experience altogether.  However, the walking paths were a bit muddy and we had to be extra careful but we thoroughly enjoyed our outing.  We had an excellent guide with us who was very knowledgable and knew everything about the park.  He was our private guide, not costly at all.  If you are visiting this country then spend a little extra it will be worth the experience you get compared to others.  We saw many beautiful birds on our way as well lot of red monkeys.  They are very shy of humans so make sure you do not make any noise when you spot them.  It is a treasure to see them jumping from the tree branches or just sitting over there.  We spotted two chameleons and our guide said that you must very lucky to have them.  He got one of them before it ran away and put them on a stick and handed it over to us.  We could see it changing colors before we let it go free in the wild and had enough of pictures with it.  The experience with Hyena was great as well as this was the first time I saw them and so close.  They do look dangerous but we had a 
Ranger protecting us while we take our picture with them having behind us in the close proximity.  The Rangers will be quite supportive if you go with a known guide and that is the difference.  They too will share lot of knowledge with you.  Eventually, you need to be friendly and taking interest and then everything else will automatically fall in place.  Don't be like another tourist.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Leuk om te zien maar...
text: Leuk om te zien maar niet heel spectaculair het is leuk voor een halve dag toer en misschien xtra leuk voor vogel liefhebbers want die zijn er veel in verschillende soorten. Hier zie je bv hyena's. Gieren. Bavianen. Enz. Is ook niet erg groot op je gemak 45 minuten ben je rond. En hyena's aanraken kun je ook niet overal maar hier dus wel.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Abuko
text: The national reservation abuko is nice place to visit during your stay in gambia despite there is not so much to see , but you can go inside the cage with hyena for example so good place for brave people.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Birdwatching with Mustapha Barry
text:
One of the first trips i made was Abuko nature park. I was with Mustapha Barry,birdwatching guide, i was amazed by his knowledge about birds and nature,
We had a nice walk and he spotted the most butifull birds like the violet and green Turaco, red-billes Hornbill,swallow-tailed Bee-eater and many more.
Also differend kind of monkeys . It was a very nice experience especially to do it with Mustapha Barry and i can recommend him as being honest,reliable and driver with his own 4x4 car. You can contact him at Kotu Bridge or by telephone (+220) 7165867

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Vogels spotten
text:
Abuko was het eerste stuk natuur dat, drie jaar na de onafhankelijkheid van Gambia in 1965, officieel werd aangemerkt als beschermd natuurreservaat. Het is één van de kleinste parken in heel West-Afrika. Maar de biodiversiteit is er hoog.

Over de uitgezette route binnen het nog geen 200 hectare omvattende park loop je van dun begroeide savanne binnen mum van tijd het dichte en groene tropisch regenwoud in.

Dertig meter hoge palmen en mahoniebomen omringen je in het holst van het park. Hun altijd groene bladerdek beneemt je deels het felle zonlicht.
Abuko is een plek voor vogelspotters bij uitstek. Neem dus vooral je verrekijker mee en geniet van de vele honderden vogels die je voorbij ziet fladderen.
Breng een bezoek aan de Makasutu Wildlife Trust, een onderzoekscentrum dat zich bezighoud met studies naar Gambia's biodiversiteit.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Boswandeling
text: Boswandeling met als afsluiting een bezoekje aan de 3 Bavianen en 5 hyena's. Niet speciaal maar het was lekker wandelen!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Nice forest but sad caged animals
text:
The forest itself is a nice and peaceful place where you can see some animals in their natural habitat. Even some rare elusive red monkeys may be seen. You can spend a relaxing hour or two walking the trails and listening the nature.

However, there are some caged animals, such as hyenas and baboons, where the trails start. They didn't seem to be doing very well and had very small space to move around in their cages.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Abuko
text:
When we first got there the guy behind the desk was so ignorant and wouldn't answer us and when he did he had such a bad attitude. 

Went around the park with a guide, very long walk, saw a few monkeys but he only really showed us trees and termite mounds, didn't see no birds, snakes or crocs.

He took us to the baboons and explained they are in cages as they are violent...
Went to see the large vulture that flew down from its perch to us, loads of other vultures flying about in the area. 
Went inside the hyenas den which was definitely an experience especially when they started walking towards us and wanting us to rub them like dogs and trying to play. I didn't know hyenas could be friendly!!

Then on leaving the park there is a massive hippos head on display, the guide said they killed the hippo as he was eating the locals rice fields, told him it's cruel and sick for keeping the head on display, he didn't agree....
 
The park has potential to be better and house more animals as it did a few years back but they need to make sure animals are taken care of and I don't think tourists will appreciate seeing a rotting hippo head!!

Apart from that, nice few hours out and a lot of walking.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Lille ø med stor historie
text: Man kan godt blive lidt skuffet ved første øjekast. Men når man ser resterne af fortet og fængslet og hører historien, er man alligevel glad ved at have taget sejlturen derover.

title: Der Weg dorthin ist das Ziel
text: Wie üblich bei historischen Monumente geht es eher um das Einfühlen in die damalige Situation als um den Ort selber. Die Fahrt dorthin kann in jedem Fall mit jeder Rallye mithalten - staubig, bumby, Africa!

title: ... leider sehr langweilig und extreme Beutelschneiderei!
text:
Durch FTI verkaufte sehr lange und langweilige Bootstour, insgesamt ist man mehr als 8 Stunden auf dem Fluß. Der Kahn war sehr marode der Mittelmotor fehlte. Dafür wurde ein 40 PS-er Außenborder achtern verbaut.
Irgendwann erreicht man einen Ort, wo in der Nähe Kunta Kinthe geboren wurde?! 
Hier erfährt man etwas über die Versklavung der Afrikaner und die Verschiffung nach Amerika.
Nach einem Fußmarsch in eine Nachbarsiedlung trifft man da auf die UR-UR-UR- Großmutter von Kunta Kinthe. Ein paar Worte zu seinem Leben. und rumreichen von diversen Papieren u. a. einer schlechten Photokopie einer Postkarte (5,-€), einem "Dokument" (5,-€), wo man selbst eintragen kann, daß man bei Kunta Kinthe gewesen war. Es geht nur ums Geld machen, für den Vortrag darf man "freiwillig spenden" und wer Süßigkeiten dabei hat, der darf  sie gleich da lassen. ob am nächsten Tag eine andere Frau da sitzt - man weiß es nicht!
Ach so, die Insel, hier stehen die Überreste von einer Festung. Der Zugang zur Insel fordert je nach Ebbe oder Flut akrobatisches Können, mehr als einen halben Meter muß man auf einmal überwinden! Nach einer kurzen Erklärung darf man noch ein paar Photos machen, die Zeit drängt...
Wir sind am Abend nach 19:00 Uhr erst wieder in Banjul angekommen.
Für Geschichtsinteressierte, macht die Ausflug mit einem Taxi, sie fahren die Tour in einem halben Tag!
z.B. Gitteh Tours, der Fahrer, Malang Lou spricht deutsch, man kann ihn über WhatsApp (002207836292) auf englisch buchen.

title: Incontournable
text: On ne repart pas de cette visite indemne , le trajet est assez long par des routes non macadamisées (environ3/4 h du ferry), vous passerez par de petits villages (si vous pouvez ,apportez des petits présents pour les enfants, bics, crayons, cahiers, peluches..).On va sur l'île en pirogue ( 10 minutes environ)on descend dans la pirogue par une échelle ( bien tenue par les locaux).Guide anglais qui relate l'esclavage non sans émotions.Il y a près du débarcadère un petit resto tenu par une dame hollandaise, on y mange très bien.En repartant vous pourrez passer à la mission où il y a un petit musée sur l'esclavage qui vaut le détour.Il y a aussi un établissement qui aide les enfants.

title: The same old things
text:
We had a quick look around the Senegambia craft market which most of the stalls were exactly the same selling wooden carvings which were dusty as been sitting about also bracelets and a few ladies sarongs but nearly all the same items.
Nothing we wanted but they were very good prices for those interested as competitive pricing due to all the stalls having the same things.
It is nice to see all the bright colours and the people were very friendly.

title: Great for presents
text:
Nice relaxed market without much hassle. Usual bartering skills required but good fun. Wife bought usual wooden carving and stuff for presents to take home (or tat as I call it)   
Easy to find at crossroads on the strip. 
Pleasant way to spend an hour and support the local trade

title: Mercadillo tipico africano
text: He visitado el pais varias veces y me suelo alojar en esta zona y siempre me doy una vuelta por este mercado, son unos cuantos puestos en los que venden  màs o menos lo mismo, figuras, manteles, pulseras, vestidos.. y en los que puedes regatear y hacer amigos entre los vendedores, merece la pena visitarlo...

title: Leuk marktje
text: Leuk marktje, geen enorme gehassle maar ze doen wel hun best om je met een leuk verhaal iets te verkopen. Veel van hetzelfde.

title: gezellig om eens over te lopen
text: Je wordt langs alle kanten aangeklampt maar zonder dat het enerverend wordt. Deze mensen moeten immers leven van hetgeen ze hier verkopen en ze hebben veelal hetzelfde in de aanbieding. We hebben hier toch wat houtsnijwerkjes ( sleutelhangers, flessenopener, gezelschapsspel, ...) en enkele batik-doeken  gekocht. Niet vergeten om te onderhandelen over de prijs: dat hoort er bij.

title: Veel troep
text: Deze craft market is niet echt bijzonder. Er wordt voornamelijk troep verkocht. Verkopers zijn opdringerig.

title: Bra lokal marknad
text:
Stor och bra marknad för lokalbefolkningen, trånga gränder och mycket att se.
Kryddor, kläder, husgeråd, färsk fisk och levande djur. 
Gå dit på förmiddagen, då det är svalare.

title: Large and colourful, very busy
text: Lots to see, probably not much you would want to buy, great to experience local life and ways and flies!

title: Quaint
text:
Lots of little stalls selling carvings etc 
Like everywhere in The Gambia the try to get your business but just say no thank you

title: Craft Market
text: Took a walk around this market, met some great people, my wife had her hair platted with extensions by Ramada and her daughter (stall no. 48) and it looks fantastic, whilst I waited I ended up playing a game of Wawaw and drinking green tea with one of the stall holders.  I and see Jimmy (stall 55) great guy to barter with.  Will visit again.

title: Small and quaint
text: This was a lovely little market designed to sell to tourists. Slightly more expensive than going to the city market, but we enjoyed the banter.

title: Nice relaxed market for clothes and bracelets
text: Lots of the same stuff, but nice to walk around during day time, than you see the best. Of course everybody wants you to enter their shops...

title: Craftmarkets
text:
It is a craftmarket like there are a lot in the Gambia. It is just nice but small.
So just pass it by and if not; you not miss a thing

title: An experience
text:
If you can handle high pressure selling and sob stories go for it. Not much to see as all stalls very much the same. Great if you want wooden crafts, jewellery or clothing but not much else.
Worth a visit as it’s true Gambia but it’s hard work they all want your time and your money

title: marktbezoek
text:
Het is een heel grote markt.
Alles is heel laag, dus mijn man 1,98 m. moest constant gebukt lopen
Erg leuk om te zien.

title: Great stuff to buy
text: One stop shopping for your crafts and what not. Great varieties from local jewelries, masks, painting and so on.

title: Feilschen ist Pflicht
text: Kleiner Handwerkermarkt mit diversen Souveniers. Man sollte unbedingt feilschen um einen guten Preis zu erhalten. Ruhig und bestimmt, so geht es am Besten.

title: Difficult to say no
text: We found, of all places we visited in The Gambia, the salesmen and women at this market the most 'agressive'. There are some nice crafts on sale but every single person literally drags you into their shop. They put stuff in the hands of our todler to make us feel obligated to buy. Of course they want to make money, but this was to much for our taste.

title: Handy little craft market for Senegamia area browsers,,.
text: Situated at the top of The Strip service road next to Sara and opposite Alex. Africa brik-a brak  that you can barging for, some import not local at all. Useful that you can get some repairs done and if you know what you want some things made.  I found a contact at Alex bar that got be a good pair of sandles hand resoled and sown D250, throw away case in UK.  And a piece of silver work made up from a photo. Again reasonable but made off site from market so took a few days.

title: Shopping
text: We meet a guy in a bar one night who said he could make carvings of our pets, so I asked if I could see his work and it was spot on, we agreed a price I messaged a photos of the dogs and paid a deposit, he issued a receipt with phone number and all info, if you want anything like this go to unit 12, you will not be disappointed. Also the lady in 13 is quite aggressive and very pushy so I bought a Gambian shirt of a polite lady in 14 hassle free

title: If in Banjul....it is there...
text:
Nothing monumental about any architecture in The Gambia and you will find some more interesting if empty modernistic office buildings dotted about. And this is no monumental arch of significance. Bland white concrete that has aged reasonably well.

Built post '94 to celebrate the military coup, which has now itself just ended in a mess of lost cash and economic tourist collapse, it has been largely ignored by the locals.  50 delasi get in and a hike of steps to the upper balcony, you do get a good photo view over the low town buildings and over to the dock cranes, over to the other side of the river on a clear day.  A bit of an ad hoc display of local art and history.

So an if in town option perhaps along with Albert Market and the football stadium.  Don't let your green car driver overcharge you on this one.

title: Must visit,The only architecture site in the Gambia
text: There is nice place to see, having excellent view to Banjul from its top balcony. Banjul is one store city, so it is a topmost point from where you can take nice shots and views to all city. Please, mind that elevators inside the column are usually broken, so you will need to climb up the spiral steps  to the top. For old people it can be hard task. There is a state museum inside with an information about The Gambia history. It is quite interesting/ I hope they will soon replace an exposition honoring their "great" doctor professor academic state savior etc. etc. former president mr. Jammeh, who was 20 years holding power robbing The Gambia so extensive, that after he was pushed out by Senegal forces in 2017, the State Treasury  appeared empty with last few millions of dollars transferred during  the last days of his presidency out of the country/ He even did not forget to take with him his luxury cars - god knows where he suppose to drive them in the Africa mostly without roads....

title: Like communist monuments
text: My guess is that they built this place for "once a year" parades. It look very communistic. But there is a nice small museum in the arch (entrance fee 50D = 1 Euro), you get a good view over Banjul from the top floor balcony. And there is a free toilet next to it. :)

title: Widok
text: Obiekt warty odwiedzenia jako klasyczny pomnik wystawiony sobie przez aktualną władzę. Jeszcze aktualną bo zmiana ma nastąpić za kilka dni. U góry wystawa wychwalająca jedynie słuszną linię Prezydenta Jammeha. Jedyny taki obiekt w tym regionie Afryki. Widok sympatyczny ;)

title: Arch 22
text: Very good and interesting place to visit, free of charge by the way and who minds giving a tip for the worker who sits by the door at the end of your visit !!

title: Näe koko Banjul
text: Kiipeä korkealle ja edessäsi aukeaa Banjul. Sisältä löytyy myös näyttely Gambian asioista. Meri ja joki yhdistyvät.

title: Gambia
text: Visited the arch, was OK lovely view stairs were quite dark and damp as a cleaner was washing them. Not somewhere you would spend a lot of time doing as not a lot at the top just for the view .

title: Quite interesting
text: Quite a hike up the steps to the top of the arch but a good museum display at the top. Great views of the area great photo stop

title: Disappointing
text:
This is a concrete building. The inside was complete empty. You can climb to the top of the building to have an overview of Banjul. The view isn't great (nothing particular to see in Banjul). Entrance was 50 dalasi or +/- 1 euro.
Visit takes 5 minutes

title: Joli point de vue sur l'ensemble de Banjul
text: Faites y une halte. Vous y découvrirez une très jolie vue sur Banjul, entourée d'eau. Quelques panneaux didactiques sont exposés, pour mieux comprendre l'histoire de ce pays.

title: nice place
text: not much to say but if you are in Banjul go and see the arch you can climb to the top for a good view

title: Prachtig monument
text: Prachtig monument in de Banjul. Alle trappen zijn we op gegaan. Wat een prachtig uitzicht ondanks de minimale bewolking.

title: Impressive
text: Built to commemorate the coup on 22/7/94 this huge impressive looking arch is well worth a visit if you are in the area. You can climb the steps to take pictures and you will also get far reaching views when you get to the top.

title: Newly constructed arch and building
text: Great to see this monument newly created in Gambia. We went to see this beautiful arch and building at its slender. The history is very interesting about the revaluation that took place. Lovely restaurant here with goof coffee and food. Parking area also at the venue.

title: Łuk Triumfalny w Banjul
text: Łuk Triumfalny , to 35-metrowa konstrukcja będąca symbolem miasta upamiętniającym bezkrwawy przewrót wojskowy, przeprowadzony w 1994r przez obecnego prezydenta Gambii Yahyę Jammeha. Jest ona również wieżą widokową, z której można zobaczyć panoramę miasta.

title: Niet te missen
text: Je kunt deze Arch niet missen als je vanuit Banjul met de Ferry naar de overkant vaart. Stukje geschiedenis.

title: Impressive looking arch
text: Impressive looking arch and a great photo opportunity. Commemorates the revolution and worth an hour of your time if  you get the chance

title: Great photos of Banjul
text: For many years it was am impressive arch to drive around and photo.  Now that you can climb up it is worth it for the views.  I have taken great city life photos without hassle.

title: Great view of Banjul
text: Just as you enter Banjul you have Arch 22 you can climb the steps to the top for great views over the Banjul

title: Small exhibition of juju medicine, good view
text: Good observation point, not too exciting. Some juju stuxff exhibited. Some tidiying up would be an ok pastime for the staff...

title: Afrikanischer Markt
text: Der Royal Albert Markt in Banjul ist Erlebnis pur. Es werden unendlich viele typische afrikanische Waren angeboten, von Kunsthandwerk über Batik, Schmuck, Holzschnitzereien, Bekleidung bis Taschen, Stoffen aller Art u.v.m. Größtenteils werden die in kleinen Ständen angebotenen Waren noch individuell handwerklich hergestellt. Ein Muss für jeden Gambia-Besucher. Allerdings sollte man keine Vorbehalte vor dem direkten Kontakt zu den stets freundlichen Anbietern haben und sich in den teils engen Gassen zwischen den Ständen nicht fürchten. Ansonsten den Markt vorsorglich mit einem einheimischen Begleiter (z. B. dem Taxifahrer) besuchen.

title: Ett ställe som man aldrig glömmer
text:
Denna utflykt var spännande på alla vis. 

Tur att man hade guide med sig annars hade vi gått där än haha . 
Otroligt trångt med mycket intryck allt från lukter till känslor . 

Vi handlade en del saker man fick pruta rejält . 
Kan rekommendera TT åka dit.

title: Typisch Afrikaanse markt
text: Een leuke, typisch Afrikaanse markt waar naast de etenswaren ook veel handgemaakte zaken en andere goederen te koop zijn. Bijzondere ervaring was het deel met veel Afrikaanse kleermakers. Mooie tour met dank aan onze gids

title: Eye opening
text: This place was amazing. Our taxi driver took us here and showed us round. It was a really busy market selling everything but it's worth it more for the experience than to buy stuff.

title: En massa saker att köpa....
text: En marknadsplats med varor i mängder. Inte mycket att se förutom det. Trångt luktar mindre gott och försäljare som är på dig.  1 timme räcker för att se denna marknad som finns många liknande på andra platser.

title: Veel leuker dan Serakunda
text: Echt nog een originele markt met alleen maar lokale mensen. Standaard dingen zoals vis,fruit vlees, kleren etc gewoon leuk en een uitstekend stuk craft waar nog hele mooie dingen te vinden zijn

title: Myllrande marknad
text: Västafrikas största marknad. Tur att vi hade vår vän Salomon med oss annars hade vi nog virrat omkring än. Jag har ju varit på många marknader i världen den här var nog den mest färgrika. Alla dessa vackra textilier. Köpte endel men kunde köpt mer. Lokala killar kommer gärna och hänger sig på fast man har en inhemsk med sig. Men det hade nog varit fler om inte han varit med oss. Hjälpte till med prutning mm. Grönsaker, kryddor, fisk i mängder. Kunde gått där hela dagen. Får bli ett till besök där. Vi var inte på delen med hantverk, så det får vara nästa mål.

title: Albert Market
text: Рынок огорчил. Очень много китайского ширпотреба, причем все это висит, лежит, стоит на самых видных и приоритетных местах. Но, если углубиться в палатку и внимательно изучить товар, можно найти африканские текстильные изделия и деревянные поделки.

title: Noise from the locals
text: The famous Albert market of Banjul is one of the oldest in the country. This market was build by the British for trade to take place  where locals can engage in all sorts of legal trade. It is a good spot if you want to enjoy real Gambian market life, with puzzling smiles and chants from sellers and buyers. It is one of the most visited place by tourist in the capital city of Banjul

title: moet je gezien hebben
text: super leuke markt waar je de lokale sfeer kan opsnuiven . hier kan je leuke dingen kopen die je elders in Gambia niet ziet . ook volledig veilig maar super druk ,

title: Som vanligt....
text:
Ännu en av dessa marknader....
Det är alltid intressant att besöka marknader i länder man besöker för att få en inblick i folklivet. Albert Market var inget undantag men den skiljer sig inte från andra marknader jag besökt; mycket folk, rörigt, bökigt och samma utbud.

title: En upplevelse man aldrig glömmer
text: En verklig upplevelse där man kan handla och njuta i en härlig atsmofär men man måste förstå lite av deras sätt att sälja sina varor och deras religion. går bra att pruta men man måste vara på sig om sitt pris ungefär 50% av deras pris kan man pruta. vänliga omtänksamma även om vissa kan vara påstridiga att sälja just sina varor.

title: Colorful markt in the open air ,
text: Colorful markt under a cloud filled with fruits and other products, .Besides food and chemistry, you will buy hand-sewn folk costumes here  and hand-made craft .Worth a visit .It  delights and encourages you to buy unforgettable handmade souvenirs .

title: Bustling colourful market
text:
Be prepared to haggle. Most stalls will start with a price 3 times what its worth so do haggle and you will get what you want at a price you want to pay. 
Lovely stall holders who can seem pushy but a no thank you usually does the trick.
Definetely worth a visit for the experience.

title: Typical African city market
text: This market is touted as the largest in Banjul. It’s best to go with a guide or someone that knows the place as it’s easy to get lost in the winding alleys and narrow ways. There’s lots to see and buy. It’s such a busy market with  everything under the sun, available. The sellers are quite pushy as everyone wants you to buy something from them. Thing is, all sellers start their prices very high and you must haggle for the best price. When you’re given a price, cut it below half and start haggling from there. Also be ready to walk away if you feel you’re being charged too much. It’s a bit like poker, sometimes with all the bluffing going on just to buy stuff but it’s part of the way of Albert market. Worth a visit to buy souvenirs and keepsakes.

title: with guide to be sure not to get lost
text:
Albert market is really a must see. It's big so getting lost is so easy. You are walking amongst sellers and buyers and the 'streets' are really narrow which makes it easy to get claustrophobia. taking pictues is really hard here because being so narrow the sellers do notice you taking a pic which they don't like at all. So be aware that they shout towards you or even are taking something to throw at you. 

We did it wit our guide Mamadi from Checkpoint Charlie tours. No stress, his task is to protect and serve and even walking at amongst the fishers on the beach gave you a save feeling. Don't forget to do that too. 

It's dirty and smelly, count on that but what a joy to visit.

title: Autentisk
text:
Et autentisk besøg på Albert market i Banjul. Her er en masse indtryk for alle sanser. Besøg gerne markedet med en en lokalguide. 
OBS. Her er meget dårlige toiletforhold
Man skal kunne klare “lugten” i de områder de sælger kød. Alle vil gerne sælge, det kræver en del afvisninger, men bestemt et besøg værd!

title: Banjul market
text: Best way to get here is to get a fixed price with a guide to help you navigate the market. It is huge and the risk of getting lost is big. It is not very touristy and you have everything from leather, to carpentry, tailoring and fish. The market has everything and try to stay calm. It can be quite stressful with all of the salesmen trying to get your attention. Therefore the guide is essential, even though he leads you to his companions in the market it helps. We went in the afternoon on a Monday and were practically the only people there. It was very special, I wouldn't say you have to see it.

title: Прикольно по африкански
text:
Африкпнская красота и колорит. Надо посетить. Купили, все что хотели , и даже что не хотели. 
Ну классно. 
Торговцы пристают сразу и много м естных попрошаек, но это не напрягает, если есть минимально опыт подобных стран.  Центральный рынок. От атлантика по берегу 10 минут

title: A real treat
text: Well there was everything here, all manner of smells - good and bad, people, sounds, things for sale and some astounding sights. Barter hard for a bargain

title: Stunning bird life
text:
West African Reserves are not to be compared with the Wild Parks of  East Africa or
Botswana. The main attraction of Abuko are the rare Red Colobus Ape and the truly stunning birdlife, so the best thing to do is to stroll the Reserve accompanied by a good bird guide. There are two hides available for birders.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Two hides available and assisted our photography out of the sun.
text: If you are bird watching or photographing then this is a must visit sight. We saw a good number of species including green and Violet Turacos along with giant Kingfishers.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Not many animals!
text: We had a nice walk round the park, but did not see any animals, and not many birds. Maksutu Cultural Forest or the monkey park near Senegambia were more fun.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Caged animals in awful conditions
text:
The 'protected' forest itself is very disappointing and most of the animals have left, bar a few monkeys. We walked through the forest with a guide but there really was nothing to point out. At the end you come to a 'rescue' centre. There are caged vultures, monkeys, tortoise, pelicans (all in one cage) and loads of uncastrated hyenas in others. 
Not a nice experience at all and sadly the 'staff' couldn't understand why we thought it was cruel and that this wasn't something that tourists wanted to see.
Very sad! Please don't visit!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Interesting place
text: This place is beautiful if your after a sedate but long nature walk with lots of birds and monkeys. The animal orphanage needs some tlc and some education on environment and animal rehabilitation but they are making the best of a bad job! It is worth a visit especially if you see the endangered west red colobus monkeys.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Amazing monkeys
text: Great place to visit although quite a long walk. The monkeys are wonderful to see but the other animals in the cages don't seem quite as happy although still well looked after.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: An Amazing Area of African Forest Close to Banjul
text: This nature preserve/research station/wild animal rehabilitation site is a must visit for anyone interested in the natural history of Gambia.  The trails are safe and easy to follow, but be careful not to stop on/near a stream of ants on the move.  Local experts are available to guide birders and further information is available at the observation deck of the Darwin Research Station.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Day trip
text: Beautiful place to visit for young and young at heart, monkeys were amazing, a little greedy but very friendly 😁

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: TODO MUY SUCIO
text: Habían muchos monos pero el descuido de este parque es total.Todo lleno de basura y el personal no tiene interés alguno por los visitantes.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A simple forest reserve
text: You can see only voltures and Monkeys and a few hyaenas. It may be a good idea to take a walk with a guide. It is a different place in the Gambia.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Klein maar fijn.
text:
De natuur is prachtig en je kan er een heerlijke wandeling maken en veel vogels spotten. Er is ook een soort mini zoo met een paar leuke dieren zoals hyenas. Vele mensen hebben hier al gereageerd hoe verschrikkelijk ze het vinden dat de dieren in kooien zitten maar het is niet veel anders dan de zoo in ons thuisland. 
Ook wist de gids ons te vertellen dat veel dieren hier zitten om een nieuwe groep te vormen van mannetjes en vrouwtjes om zo hopelijk weer in het wild te kunnen leven.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A nice place to walk but I don't want to see anyone in cages
text:
Most of the Abuko park is nice and the monkeys are free, but there's also a part where they keep some monkeys and even an eagle in cages! The cages are too small and they do not seem to have a nice and happy life. I don't think that such intelligent creatures should be held in a prison and it made me sad to see that.

But if you skip the zoo part you might enjoy it, because it's a really nice place for a walk. They don't want to let you go inside without a local guide, but don't mind them, you won't get lost! If you get a guide, you need to pay for the entrance fee and also some tip to the guide - not worth it. You'll see the monkeys and lots of birds anyway :)

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Interesting venue
text: We have visited a couple of times on our way to and from other attractions.  Interesting  walk and park even for those who are not serious bird watchers.  Also a small zoo.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Nothing outstanding but a nice nature walk
text:
We visited this park along with Lamin Lodge on a tour from Kololi. 

They insisted we paid for a tour guide to take us through the park, the guide was very uninformative, not really talking to us or telling us about the park but simply trying to get around as quickly as possible the forcibly asking for a large tip. It would have been much nicer to simply take our time and wonder through the reserve.

It was generally a pretty reserve and we did see some green vervet monkeys who were quite happy to have their photo taken but if this is what you are looking for then Bijilo park is a much better nature park with more monkeys and just as nice/nicer scenery.

There were Baboons and Hyenas in cages in one section but I tend not to like seeing animals unnecessarily in cages so did not find this an enjoyable part of the park. They had also had a hippo there which had died recently and they kept its head on display (not pleasant to look at!)   

We had a nice day but I didn't think this park and any advantages over Bijilo

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Vogelspotten maar weinig wilde apen
text: Vogelspotten is leuk, maar niet heel veel te zien! Veel gieren. Leuke wandeling door de natuur. Enkele apen in het wild gezien. Hyena's en apen opgesloten...

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Triest om deze dieren achter lelijk gaas te zien.
text:
Met een privé gids dit park aan het einde van de dag bezocht.
We mochten met de auto naar het terrein waar de hyena's waren. We zagen de hyena's in een grote ren achter een dubbele laag kippengaas. In een andere ren zaten een paar apen ,een jong hert, een schildpad en een gier. Diverse apen konden zich wel vrij bewegen. We waren niet gecharmeerd van deze plek. Nu ik de geplaatste foto 's bekijk denk ik dat onze gids ons veel niet heeft laten zien.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Book A Guide BEFORE You Go
text:
As much as I wanted to visit Abuko I was almost put off by some of the things said in the negative reviews but we were booking some bird watching trips with a bird guide and he assured us it was an important place to visit. He was not wrong! 
Our very informative guide, Musa Manneh (+220) 7834098, showed us a total of 51 different species of wonderful colourful and spectacular birds that day along with an abundance of information about the various plant, insect and animal species we were seeing along our walk. Although he predominantly a bird guide he is very knowledgeable about the natural history of Gambia and will give insights into the local culture too. 
It is very evident to me that the way to get the best out of this place is to arrange with someone who understands it to take you there. Avoid booking a trip with a mini bus full of people, you will disturb any wildlife as the mass of people tramp through the well trod paths of the reserve. Individual guiding is not as expensive as you might imagine in The Gambia and it pays massive dividends in how much it improves your experience of these places. You only have limited time during your holiday so why waste it by handing a poultry sum to a bumster who will walk with you but not give you any insight or understanding to the things you are seeing and not help you to see the things that prefer not to be seen! 
During our time there so many people walked right past us as we were standing watching some magnificent bird, once or twice people would stop to look in the direction I was pointing my camera lens and we would point out what we were seeing. 
A guide you have employed to take you there will ensure you avoid unwelcome advances from the bumsters and ensure you are proceeding at a pace that suits your stamina and ability, at least that is what we experienced with Musa. 
We set off early so we could avoid being there at the hottest time of the day. Musa also took us to explore an area of paddy fields opposite the reserve before we went in and that area was simply amazing. If anyone wished to book him before they leave home then they can do so via email musaamanneh56@yahoo.com and you can find his website by typing Musa Manneh Bird Watching Tours into your search engine. The man is a gentleman who will provide a car with a very safe driver and take great care of you, he speaks perfect English too.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Great Photo opportunities
text: We visited Abuko as part of trip with Arch tours and really enjoyed it, great photo opportunities for bird watching and general wildlife.  We saw loads of different birds including a giant kingfisher. At the end of the trail is a small zoo area which has baboons and Hyenas, however this is not best part of reserve.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Niet de moeite
text: Zat mee in een tourpakket maar geen aanrader ... Niks te zien ... Enkel op het eind paar apen in kooi .... Jammer niet aan te raden

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: a long walk to a small zoo
text: Abuko costs very little to get in - less than £1. The guide didn't really talk to us so we gained little from having him. Essentially you walk a long way to see animals in cages - not what we expected. Although the animal keepers took us inside the hyena pen which was pretty amazing. Then the long walk back and pushy market sellers on the way out - you have to be firm if you don't want to buy! Much preferred bijilo park.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Niet groot wel bijzonder
text: Geen groot park, verwacht er niet teveel van. Desondanks een bijzondere ervaring. Onze taxi was ook onze gids en gaf ons een tour met volle passie

title: BELLE EXPERIENCE
text:
Alors, nous sommes là, au cœur de Bakau, en Gambie, et nous venons découvrir le fameux Kachikally Crocodile Pool.
C'est incroyablement fascinant. Imaginez-vous, un site de 9 acres avec une piscine sacrée, un musée ethnographique, un mini-sentier forestier, et même une buvette à proximité. C'est comme entrer dans un autre monde.
Dès notre arrivée, nous sommes plongés dans cette atmosphère mystique. Les Gambiens locaux nous ont raconté que ce lieu est réputé pour ses pouvoirs de guérison. Les gens viennent ici pour chercher des bénédictions, et certaines femmes stériles viennent même prier pour concevoir. C'est impressionnant de voir à quel point ce lieu est important pour la communauté locale.
En explorant la piscine, nous avons été étonnés de voir environ 80 crocodiles, certains somnolents sur les berges. Et le plus étonnant, c'est que nous sommes autorisés à les toucher !
Alors pourquoi pas ? Après notre expérience précédente avec les lions, rien ne peut plus nous arrêter ! Ces reptiles sont nourris exclusivement de poisson deux fois par semaine, et malgré leur proximité avec les marais salés, l'eau de la piscine reste fraîche et accueillante. Néanmoins, pas vraiment l'envie de plonger parmi eux, nous nous contentons de nous approcher par l'arrière et de les toucher
La peau est moins épaisse que je l'imaginai, les écailles restent souples. Pour faire avancer le crocodile il faut presser néanmoins assez fortement la base de la queue
L'histoire et les légendes entourant ce lieu sont tout aussi captivantes. On nous a raconté comment le sanctuaire de la piscine a été révélé à la famille Mandingue Bojang il y a plus de 520 ans. Une autre histoire parle d'une entité surnaturelle, une femme Djinn, qui aurait perdu son enfant ici, donnant ainsi naissance à la sanctification du puits.
Et le musée de Kachikally est tout simplement remarquable. Avec ses 1 000 artefacts historiques exposés dans quatre huttes rondes africaines, il nous plonge encore plus profondément dans l'histoire de Bakau et des nombreux groupes ethniques de la Gambie. C'est comme un voyage dans le temps, une immersion totale dans la culture et les traditions locales.
En fin de compte, notre découverte du Kachikally Crocodile Pool et de son musée restera gravée dans nos mémoires comme une expérience inoubliable. C'est vraiment une perle rare, un trésor de la Gambie que nous sommes reconnaissants d'avoir eu l'occasion de découvrir.
VOYAGEAVECNOUS.COM
FB ET INSTA AUTOURDUMONDE2023

title: Fantastic
text:
Visted around 11am and it seems to be a good time to go. Not busy or rushed. Guide was knowledge and good fun. A wonderful opportunity to find out and get up close to these fascinating animals.
They are well cared for and happy to tolerate humans as they are well fed. Do listen to the guide as some pregnant crops will not be so happy to be approached. 
Great local information in  series of rooms on the way in about tribes, musical instruments, and info about military history.
Entrance fee 100 D and an opportunity to leave a contribution to help towards food for the crops.

title: Kort maar krachtig 🐊
text:
Heel klein, je bent er zo doorheen. Entree 100D (ongeveer 1,36€)
Je komt binnen in een heel klein museum, dat niks met krokodillen te maken heeft. Maar wel interessant is. Daarna is het een stukje lopen en sta je tussen de krokodillen. Deze zijn heel rustig. Sommige leken wel levende beelden. Je mag ze even aanraken, daar reageren ze niet op (dus geen last van) De krokodillen zouden zo rustig zijn omdat ze veel voedsel krijgen en dus niet hoeven te jagen (een krokodil kan dagen zonder eten) dus ze liggen daar uit te buiken. Ook zouden de krokodillen vegetarisch zijn🤣 
Er ligt op het eind een boek waarin je je naam kunt zetten en een bijdrage kunt doen. Daar vriendelijk voor bedankt. 
Stel je er niet teveel van voor.

title: Croc Pool
text: Informative little museum about the different tribes and history of The Gambia. Wonderful experience to stand amongst the crocodiles!

title: Amazing
text: Unbelievable experience,  we get to touch the crocodiles and the staff was very helpful and informative.  Fee entrance is only 100 dalasi which is nothing so we donate some money as well

title: Amazing experience
text: Different experience, touching crocodiles. We went with a local guide Lamin Marong, who picked us up from hotel , drove to the pool, guided us through the museum and then to the pool, where a keeper told us which ones we could touch, then Lamin drove us back, with a brief visit to a war graves cemetery, all for £20

title: Crocs, crocs and more crocs
text:
Never seen so many! The more you look, the more you see. Very knowledgeable guides ensure your visit is safe. There are some cross you can actually touch
Also a very interesting museum about Gambias recent history is on the same site.

title: Go see the crocodile
text:
Lovely place  But make no mistake these listen to your guide if you want to touch them I did and must admit my heart was racing 
But well worth going to see them up close

title: Don't Shed Tears for These Crocodiles
text: Over a dozen crocodiles laying al around the pool, mostly sleeping.  You get to walk a path with your guide around the place when suddenly you notice there is no fence between you and those crocodiles about 4 feet away.  Luckily, only a few are moving and you are really glad they were fed earlier in the day.  I would question your fitness as a parent if you brought your kiddos on your visit.  Just remember if you want to touch one (and people do) touch the crocodile as far away from its mouth as possible.  If you love Komodo Island and its free roaming dragons you will like this place.

title: Leuk om eens te zien maar het stelt niet heel erg veel voor!
text: We hadden een fietstour geboekt en dit was een van de stops. Als eerste ga je naar binnen bij een klein museumpje wat ook op dit park is. Onze gids heeft de vrouw bij de deur wat geld gegeven dus ik weet zelf niet wat de entree is. Je ziet hier aan de hand van foto's met Engelstalige uitleg en Afrikaanse maskers een stukje geschiedenis van Gambia. Het stelt weinig voor eerlijk gezegd. Je loopt er aan de achterkant weer snel uit naar de krokodillen waar het om gaat. Leuk om eens te zien. Er liggen er veel, zo'n 100 zouden er daar leven. Het is tevens een soort opvang hebben we begrepen. Er zitten ook veel "begeleiders" bij. Ze zijn vriendelijk en helpen om leuke foto's te maken van jou en de krokodillen als je dat wilt. Je mag 1 krokodil ( de albino) ook aanraken om foto's te maken als je wilt. Hier wordt geen geld voor gevraagd. De krokodillen liggen overal en nergens (vooral ook veel in de vijver die bedekt is met veel blad dus die zie je niet) en je loopt er gewoon omheen. Er wordt gezegd waar je het beste kunt lopen zodat het veilig is. Na zo'n 20 minuten heb je het wel gezien. Daarna wordt er wel gevraagd om een kleine bijdrage om vis te kunnen kopen voor de krokodillen. Ook wordt er een tafeltje met spullen geshowd (stiften, kleurboeken etc.) Ze proberen je dit te laten kopen voor de kinderen die je nog gaat zien in Gambia. Je kunt het dan uitdelen. Wij hebben dit niet gedaan maar wel wat geld gegeven voor de vis en de moeite die ze deden om leuke foto's van ons te maken.

title: à voir
text:
very interesting site, apparently in activity since centuries. 
There is a little interesting museum, a  park and LOTS of crocodiles.
You may even touch some of them. 
The explanations given by the guide on how the keep the crocodiles number under control were not convincing at all, so we remain with the question.

title: Interesting and fun
text:
Never believed I could be comfortable walking amongst a bunch of very large crocodiles, and even petting one, but I was. There is an interesting history to this place. The owner has fed the crocs only fish for their entire lives, and they have been acclimated to people, so as long as you follow their instructions to move slowly and ONLY pet their backs, you are safe.

Makes for a great photo op! And the museum outside is definitely worth a stop.

title: Awesome Experience
text: This must see site was in walking distance from.our hotel,but it did mean a walk through Bakau old town which is a poverty striken area with lots of kids begging for sweets, so I was glad we hired a guy of the beach to take us there, as his presence made the journey there very easy.  The entrance fee is only 100 DL ( just over £1) and there is an interesting museum about the history of Gambia to go through before one hits the jungle trail. There is a well trodden path, through some huge trees and local monkeys until you hit the pool, where rangers will arrange for visitors to pose with and touch the crocs for some great photo opportunities.  These are fresh water crocs and are fish eaters, and well fed. So humans are quite safe, but even do ard visitors are told to keep well away from the crocs mouths in case you confuse the crocs and they take a bite. If you are lucky on your visit you may get to see Charlie the albino Croc. A good and cheap way to spend a couple of hours.

title: Crocodile
text: Gemengde gevoelens omdat ik niet hou van de exploitatie van dieren maar er is me verteld dat er goed voor de dieren en nakomelingen gezorgd wordt. Dan is het wel een bijzondere ervaring tussen de krokodillen te lopen en ze aan te raken

title: Fantastic experience
text: This was my 2nd visit to Katchikally Crocodile Pool once again it was a remarkable wondrous experience. We went quite late in the day plus it was ramadan time so it was very quiet. We were the only people there. There was a 200 delacies entrance fee. Before going to see the crocodiles there is a small museum we walked around which consisted of 3 rooms with information  about the area , pictures and a few historical artefacts. The whole way round we were accompanied by a cat. He literally walked everywhere with us until we got to the exit of the rooms. Instinctively the cat stopped at the door and left us to continue out towards the crocodiles. She obviously knew not to go out there around the crocodiles, we stopped at a very ver old massive cotton tree on the way towards the crocodiles. The young man who cared for the crocodiles were so informative and put us at ease as when we got out towards the crocodiles. On this occasion, there were plenty of them out on the land. We counted at least 12 crocodiles amongst leaves and against the trees. This was a scarily wonderful experience to be this close to the crocodiles, we even saw the albino crocodile which was so big. The young man showed us the crocodile eggs and told us about the crocodiles. We made a small donation towards feeding the crocodiles as they must go through a large amount of fish to keep them going. This was a fantastic experience. Definitely not for the faint hearted.

title: Pool of Crocs
text:
Located about 30 minutes from Banjul, in the Bakau district, is the Kachikally Sacred Crocodile Pool believed by the locals for its healing powers and as a place of last resort for infertile women who wish to conceive.  the women seeking the special blessing are washed by trained women and are told not to shake hands with anyone in Bakau. Others with ailments come to the pool to seek luck and make offers to the crocs in return.  The walk to the pool is reached from the mail road by a 600-meter dirt pathway that is lined by poverty-stricken housing and dozens of young children approaching you asking for money or school supplies.

The  entrance wall is colorfully painted with wildlife scenes. Once inside, you walk on a path towards the pool where it is said that there are over 80 crocodiles in and around the pool  but we only saw four small crocks. The well-fed crocs are docile.  Visitors are allowed to touch or stroke the tail--not the head.  

Expect to spend about 30 minutes in the facility.  Other than the few crocs there is not much to see.  Worth a visit if you are in the area but otherwise not much to see although it is described as a popular tourist site.  At the end of the tour the owner requests "donations" to feed the crocs.

title: Superrrr
text:
Super heerlijk genoten in Gambia bij de crocodile pool! 

Ik raad mensen aan echt een lokale gids te nemen: veel meer persoonlijke aandacht, je steunt de locals en zit niet met 60 man in een busje haha. Heel de dag privé chauffeur mee voor niets. Tip, wij hadden het met Abdul geregeld, super leuke gast! (www. abdul-gambia. nl)

title: Lots of Crocs!
text:
Yes this is good to do if staying in the area, but you will need a taxi to get there. The park itself is off the main highway and at the bottom of a very local impoverished area.
Entrance fee is 100 dalasi per adult (guides/ drivers free). You do not need a guide for this attraction. 
There’s a very small museum beside the park, a very short walk to the crocodile pool and that is all there is. 
You can “stroke” the albino crocodile, see others lying around in the sun and there’s opportunity  to make a donation towards the cost of feeding them. Allow 30-45 mins max for this attraction. 

Truthfully the poverty on the streets surrounding the park was more of an experience and impacting than seeing the crocodiles but that’s the reality of living in The Gambia….for some life is very hard.

title: A very worthwhile trip.
text: My wife and I visited the crocodile pool whilst on a recent holiday in Bakau. We hired the services of an excellent  local tour guide, Babucarr Fofana. Babu's office is in a street kiosk directly in front of the Ocean Bay Hotel in Bakau. Babu took us on a walk around Bakau to see some sights we were interested in. We went to the National Botanical Gardens, where Babu organised for us to tour the gardens with the Director of the gardens, who explained the plant species we were viewing and the relevance of the plants to the Gambia ecology and economy. Babu then took us to the Bakau Community School and onwards to the Katchikally Crocodile Pool. Babu gave us a guided tour of the museum at the pool and then the pool itself. He is a very knowledgeable guide with excellent English. Babu said we would have the opportunity to stroke the crocodiles, but what he hadn't told us was that they are free to roam the grounds. At first we found this a little alarming, but the pool guide explained that the crocodiles were fed every morning and that they would then not be interested in people unless disturbed. Indeed, all the crocodiles were sunning themselves and quite amenable to being stroked....carefully. The purpose of the pool and the crocodiles was explained to us and its continuing importance in Gambian folklore and society. All in all an excellent and interesting trip.

title: Excellent
text: They made me a Zebra so happy with it the quality of craft work here is of avert high standard definitely worth a visit

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: One of the best
text:
I like this market because there is less hassle than some of the others in Gambia. You can see the things being made. Men with a chunk of wood between their feet hammering away and some of the things they make are amazing.
If you want to buy then be prepared to haggle for a good price. Great fun.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Well worth a visit
text: The craftmanship put into the figures are outstanding true Gambia products. Very busy market and plenty of stalls to visit and gifts for home and very reasonable priced. Get yourself a local guide for these markets to stop getting hassled. Good and pleasant exsperience.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Best Market in the country
text: I have visited the country several times and have yet to discover another market to equal this one.  The stall holders are friendly and in most cases low pressure, just come and look.  I buy most of my souvenirs here as I am given time to look.  I have had several wood articles carved at the market for me.  If the object wasn't done correct it is either fixed or another is carved.  Special items made usually take a couple of days.  There are a couple of market holders that will sell you items (especially cloth) that may not be the correct size for the price of a proper size so you do need to beware, but over all I found this market to be an excellent place to shop.  Please remember that even though the wood is from The Gambia most items are carved by the Senegalese.  I have some amazing pieces of work at home from the market ought at reasonable prices.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Pleasant shopping
text:
I went early, about 9am as the little shops were opening. It was quiet and cool at this time. There was no pressure to buy, but encouragement to look inside each shop - not onerous. The quality of goods is reasonable. Don't expect amazing works of art, but I bought a couple of lovely wraps/sarongs to wear on the beach, which were prettier and as good quality as anything I have seen in the UK. As others have said, bargaining is expected. No idea if I got a good price for the few things I bought, but I paid no more than the things were worth to me. 

At the left of the market as you face it, is a small cafe which doesn't look anything but has a reliable and reasonably clean loo - handy if you have tummy trouble.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Low pressure market
text: After the hassle of Albert Market in Banjul - Bakau was a delight.  Friendly un-pressured stall holders meant we could browse and find things we wanted.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Slightly out of the ordinary
text: So many African craft markets are carbon copies of each other, and the items for sale differ little. This shop is enough out of the ordinary to make the effort to visit. Very little hassle from locals.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Africa
text: Hier worden alle houten beeld en beeldjes gemaakt, echt heel mooi om te zien hier gebruiken ze echt de handen maar ook de voeten tijdens het houtsnijwerk

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Çok iyi oyma eserler var
text: Magnet ve oyma eserler alınabilir çok sayıda dükkan var. Pazarlık yapmayı unutmayin burda heryerde pazarlık yapın taksilerde dahil

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good for holiday gifts
text: We love to visit the craft market. Plenty of stalls selling a wide variety of goods to suit any budget. Lots of characters. Don't forget to barter!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Mooi handwerk
text: Alle beelden en beeldjes worden door de plaatselijke kunstenaars gemaakt  terwijl je op staat te kijken maar het is overal hetzelfde. Ook allerhande mandjes en fruitkorfjes zijn zeer prachtig

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Craft's
text: If you want to take away any local gift's, then this is the place to visit. If they haven't got what you are looking ffor they will make it for you so you could have it the next day an amazing place to try out your haderling skill's.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Heel leuk om even te gaan kijken
text: Het is zeker de moeite waard om even te gaan kijken naar de leuke dingen die ze maken. Ze proberen je uit te leggen, wat en hoe ze het doen en dat is voor de kinderen heel erg leuk.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Worth a Quick Look
text:
Like so many markets around Africa, and the world for that matter, if you have not been to many, this will be something new and exciting even though it is small. If you have travelled extensively, you might find it boring.

I have travelled extensively but surprisingly found it a little interesting. I did not expect to see lots of new and original things I had not seen before, and I did not. It was pleasant though to get some fresh air in a small market that is less crowded and has more open space than most. I hated the fact that people wanted to bargain. I know some people enjoy that but I simply find it a waste of my time. Tell me your best price and I will buy if I like what I hear. Some of the stall owners did not heed this warning from me and lost my business. By the time I got past a few stalls, everyone knew they better just tell me what they really would charge. I ended up buying a small boat and some place mats.

Please do not buy any jewellery that supposedly is made from or has on it crocodile teeth. They sell parts of cow bone and then lie about its origins. When I confronted some of the people about this, one eventually admitted the truth. My taxi driver was also angry with them as he feels that, besides being dishonest, he could be tainted with the same brush just for bringing me to the market.

In conclusion, whether you are an experienced traveller or not, I would say go. Perhaps you see nothing new but at least you will have tried.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: good fun and good value
text:
worth a visit, be prepared to bartar.
don't be pushed to buy, make it clear you want to visit each shop, have a good look and then go back and make your offer

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: colourful
text: Okay for a quick browse,( take a guide with you unless you are firm). You will be hassled and it's the same type of thing, but very lively and colourful

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Lovely..............
text:
The stalls are, almost universally, lovely;  with carvings, cloths and general souvenirs to please and enchant the pickiest tourist, you'll soon find yourself reaching for your wallet.

Don't forget to haggle!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Nice Handmade things !
text: If you like to collect or fond of collecting handmade or crafty things ..this is is must visit place for you :)

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: i lived in Gambia not holiday maker sorry am biased
text: I loved everything about Gambia the people very friendly must do tours to schools families and Banjul.restaurants very good  Sea Shells ex, also Darbos good music

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: unbeleivable
text: Loved this market, and can only smile about the locals wanting to charge you dalasi for a photograph.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Geen rustig bezoekje
text: Helaas leren ze het niet af, ze trekken je bijna overal naar binnen. Iets rustig bekijken is hier onmogelijk, zo jammer dit. Dan maar naar de serunda Market.

title: Do all your Gambian gift shopping in one place!
text:
Senagambia Craft Market is many things: busy, fascinating, unchanging and exciting. 
I first visited in the late 90s and I'm almost convinced the same stuff was still on sale. The traders are still extremely polite but can be very pushy and the craftspeople who work in the market are still making wonderful stuff at a price that is unbeatable - but you do need to haggle. 
The woodcarvers near the entrance are a lovely bunch of lads. They work so hard to produce really well made items. I commissioned a carved elephant and collected it the very next day. It might be as well to remember that there is a weight limit on planes as that almost turned into a very expensive elephant indeed. Fortunately I got away with it...
Don't be afraid to haggle and remember that the price given for the goods on sale can be reduced if you push - just, not too much eh? Its better when both parties get a good deal.
Enjoy the market and make sure you go right to the very end where there is a stall that promises no hassle. Just don't believe a word of it! lol.
The market takes about an hour or two to look around properly. I returned several times and found something new to look at on each occasion.

title: Peter crowe
text: The craft market situated at the entrance to the strip is a must place to visit  for gifts or just to look around plenty of hand made items for sale with no set prices  "haggle away  great fun

title: Holiday
text:
Love visiting  any market in the world.  This market has many stalls lots of banter,  
Lots of bracelets for sale, everyone wants you the look in their shops on their stalls.  Love chatting with the locals here people are so friendly and poilet.  Go and take in some culture.

title: Hot and traditional craft market
text: Worth a visit, but be prepared to haggle and resist the pleas to by something/ anything from every stall!

title: Too much hassling
text: Here are so many stalls selling the same thing & nearly all stall holders are part of a “ cartel”. Beware being dragged inside to negotiate a price which is always, at least double if not more the correct price. Much of the goods are substandard. Many of the carvings are of a poor quality and they are liable to split when brought home.

title: Craft Market
text: There are quite a few stalls which are packed in to a relatively small space. As always the Gambian people were very friendly and it was fun bartering with the stall holders.

title: Quelques souvenirs
text:
Endroit où trouver les souvenirs . Les gens sont pas faciles à négocier.
Mieux vaut aller à brikama, semblable mais en fait les gens de kololi achètent à brikama.
Mais ça reste un endroit agréable pour se promener.  Entrée gratuite. Ouvert de 9h à 18h.

title: Worth a nose
text: Strolled in as it was very near to our hotel, all the traders were very quick to want to pounce, this was probably as the season has just started but they were all friendly enough

title: nice little market
text: Nice little market. Well worth a visit and dont forget to barter when you get there. It is also right on the beach and next to Dominos bar

title: An experience not to be missed
text: If you like to haggle go here, there is lots of choice and you can certainly pick up an African object which has been locally made by hand

title: Not a bad option if you are not venturing.....
text: It's a good option if you are not venturing very far, don't have much time and want to get a feel of purchasing items if you are staying in that location. Bartering is the key to most transactions in Gambia.

title: Fijn bezoek
text: Leuke spullen maar erg gericht op toerisme. Weinig locals en toeristische prijzen. Wel de moeite waard om een bezoekje te brengen.

title: Heerlijke curry
text: Super lekkere curry gegeten! Het is iets duurder dan gemiddeld maar het is het wel waard! Vooraf krijg je een mandje brood. De sfeer binnen is iets minder gezellig maar het eten was heerlijk. Later kwam hier nog een zuid Afrikaanse groep optreden. Echt een aanrader als je van curry houd!

title: Nive but
text:
This craft market is located at the end of the strip on the right side near the crossing.  
yes, it is a tourist trap but on the other hand you get the opportunity to learn the game of buying souvenirs in a small market. in a bigger market like the one in banjul - albert market - is the same game only 10 times bigger .

You find literally everything there, even several times. So the best thing is to go around and see what is where available. 
Your second round you can decide what you buy where.

If you want to walk around at your pace, just tell them that you are looking around . 

when you want to buy make sure to cut the price . if it is to low, they will not sell, don't worry.

title: Hectische drukte van verkopers
text: Daar er enkel shops zijn van houtsnijwerk,textiel, soeveniers en zilver is het aanbod te kiezen zeer beperkt. Dit brengt met zich mee wanneer je eenmaal deze craftmarket hebt bezocht je geen tweede maal terug keert. Zeer beperkt aanbod, ze zouden best wat nieuwe artikelen en verschillende verkopen.

title: Even doen
text: Een overzichtelijke markt met leuke spullen.  Het werkt hier natuurlijk hetzelfde als overal, maar misschien dat je toch een leuk koopje kunt doen.

title: vol
text: De markt is vol met kraampjes en stalletjes. Overal wordt gevraagd even te kijken. Mooie spullen maar ook veel van hetzelfde

title: hout snijwerk te overvloed
text:
leuk houtsnijwerk marktje waar van alles te koop is ook diverse kleding voor leuke prijzen
aan het begin van de strip makkelijk te vinden

title: tourist attraction.
