text: Whilst i was living there this market was where i had dresses made,  sandals etc. Good place to buy your presents for home. Lovely friendly people, but shop around as prices differ!

title: Leuker dan de dierentuin
text: Een mooie trip gemaakt naar Abuko. Gebruik gemaakt van 'tanka tanka', dat wil zeggen steeds overstappen op lokale taxi's die heen en weer tijden tussen vaste punten. Spotgoedkoop. Een lokale gids is wel een aanrader. Even onderhandelen over de prijs is zinvol. Neem er de tijd voor, want het is ook een heerlijk wandelgebied. Stel je niet te veel voor van de diersoorten. In ieder geval heb je die gids nodig om deze dieren te zien. Voor wat betreft mogelijk gevaarlijke dieren zoals de hongerige krokodillen, zou ik zeggen: die heb je nodig om ze tijdig te zien!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Scam
text:
Just a word of warning,the so called guides at Abouko have nothing whatsover to do with Abouko Park,they are just chancers or 'Bumsters' if anyone cares to look at earlier previous posts it will be explained in more detail there,since the funding for the park was stopped a few years ago all the official guides are well gone. If your putting money in a box at the lodge next to the so called croc pool that goes straight into the bumsters pocket.
Regarding 'Eagle Heights' with the Lion Cubs,Cheetahs etc ( all poisoned) it was a front for a bird of prey import scam to the UK,which is well documented on Facebook.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Poor quality zoo with some wild monkeys.
text:
Situated just outside town this reserve is said to host “displaced” animals in an attempt to help preserve Gambias wildlife.  There are plenty of sightings of Vervet Monkeys which are well habituated to humans (they can be very amusing)  and some Red Colobus Monkeys are also present.  

But essentially it’s really just a small open air zoo.  A troop of Baboons is kept in a fairly spacious enclosure,  with a couple of cages Hyena nearby to the drinks stall.
People tell of ongoing improvement work,  but there was no sight of actual improvement on the ground since 2012,  and considerable degradation since that visit.

Worth a visit  -  I don’t think so.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Nice walk
text: Visited here with my gambian boyfriend, my son and another couple. I thought it was a really nice walk and plenty of animals to see. I particularly liked the fact that the majority of them were free to roam around.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Excellent place to  see birds, crododiles and small mammals
text: If you like nature, this is a must see in Gambia. In particular the view point on the little lake was marvellous with its many birds and crocodiles. We saw several monkeys. There are fierce looking hyenas in a separate fenced area.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A lot has changed in a year
text: The park was a good day out last year with hyena, cheetahs, a lion cub and monkeys, however in the past year both cheetahs and the lion cub have died raising my concerns. The monkeys and hyenas are still nice to see though

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A bit diasapointing
text: We went here by taxi and a guide was waiting for us to show us around. The guide seemed to be in a rush and didn't take time to tell u something about the parc. We saw some monkeys but you can see them in many places around. There are some hyena's and other types of monkeys but they are caged and seemed to be very bored. It is easy to find your way around the parc, a guide is really not needed, so I would save the money next time.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Great for bird watching
text: Hundred of birds to chase with a camera and tripod or a telescope. You are welcomed by monkeys then as you walk trough the forest, you can enjoy the beauty of the jungle as it is, with birds and lizards and butterflies and crocs. You definitely need a good guide, not for not getting lost but for information about the birds, trees and everything.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Si eres un birdwatching, no te lo puedes perder.
text: La reserva a pesar de estar un poco abandonada y con aspecto empobrecido, es un lugar muy recomendable para los aficionados a la fotografía de naturaleza y la observación de aves. En una mañana puedes ver entre varias decenas de especies de aves africanas. Lo ideal es estar en la puerta a primera hora y entrar según abren la puerta... Es una pena ver las hienas en la jaula en malas condiciones... Por lo demás muy recomendable.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Zonde van de tijd
text:
Aangezien Abuko was opgenomen in een excursie, gingen we hier heen met onze gids. Maar het was zonde van de tijd. Er zit geen wild, of je moet de opgesloten bavianen, de gier ende hyena's als wild zien. Deze dieren zitten in veel te kleine kooien opgesloten. Het is dieronvriendelijk. In de vijver zou ook nog een verdwaalde krokodil moeten zitten, maar die hebben we niet gezien.
Als je Abuko niet zou bezoeken, dan mis je niets.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Interesting but not worth a return visit.
text: Their information centre needed updating when we were there four years ago -perhaps that has happened by now?  The monkeys were engaging but the crocs were a bit shy and hiding away when we looked  for them,

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Enkele aapjes en de rest achter tralies
text:
Er zijn wat aapjes, maar die zie je elders ook. De antilopes zijn al opgegeten door de omliggende dorpen (aldus onze gids), de krokodillen zijn altijd onderwater (jaja) en de bavianen en heyena's zitten opgesloten in veel te kleine ruimtes of kooien, een vreselijke vertoning. Je loopt een beste wandeling (niet geschikt voor kleine kinderen of ouderen) en ziet bijna niets. 
Samengevat, wegblijven!!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Perhaps Not A Fair Review
text: A taxi driver took me here recently only to be told when we arrived that the place was closed. He was surprised to hear this. However, I spoke a few days later with a different, experienced taxi driver that I have done a lot of business with, and he explained to me that many of the animals that had been there had died, which is why they had to close their doors. I am not sure what happened and I am not sure when they will be opening again but I thought I would post the information I was give here for other people who might be planning to visit Abuko.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: all'abbandono!!
text: piccola riserva nel cuore della citta', che purtroppo nel corso degli ultimi anni a mio avviso e' stata un po' trascurata e lasciata all'abbandono. comunque una buona occosione di fare una passeggiata nella natura, con la possibilita' di vedere diversi tipi di animali... il tutto ad un prezzo molto basso.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Beautiful
text:
Lovely walks through forest,  chance to see Crocs in the Lake, and in the centre they had free roaming monkeys who came and happily took peanuts from your hands, and anything in your pockets was lovely. My best experience was befriending a young baboon there, he was very friendly and affectionate and was a delight seeing him playing with the other Monkeys. They had hyenas there, vultures and a little place to get a bite to eat. Easily spend a couple of hours there. 
You can take a guide or go in on your own,  easy to find your way around doing it alone. 
Truly loved it!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Money scam
text:
I had an experience very similar to that of zippideedoodle below.

My group and I (consisting of Gambians and Europeans interested in conservation and wildlife) had wanted to explore the park freely for the local wild nature.  We were pressured into hiring a guide who was not overall very informative but did point out some different species, 

The guided then took us out a side gate to Eagle Heights, without informing us this is what was happening. He wanted us to pay another guided to show us some of the animals they have there  - an experience we didn't even want. We did not pay and got walked back along the road to the entrance of the nature reserve. 

It could have been a very different experience.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Tinham aninhais no parque ?
text:
Tive oportunidade de visitar outros dois parques nesta viagem: Bijilo Forest Park (Gâmbia) e Fathala (Senegal).
Em qualquer um destes vemos mais e mais bem tratados animais

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: monkey park - fab
text: went for a day at the monkey park.  You aren't supposed to feed the monkeys but our guide got us bags of nuts.  the monkeys jump on your shoulders and take the nuts out of your hand.  very friendly and cute. well worth a visit there.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Good walk round but beware that the English owners charge europeans more for entry.
text: Visited in Feb 2015 and enjoy Abuko very much having a walk round and feeding the monkeys. Seeing the lion was nice as was the birds and snakes all in all was worth the money.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Like and big park
text:
For many years ago it was a nice place where they had names on evert special trees and there were so many different animals there, but now I'm disappointed because it's mostly apes and births there now day. It's like the forgotten place where they just send tourists for having anything to do.
If you want to go there take your time early in the morning or around 6 in the evening. Then you will have a chance to se some of the animals.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Als je dan toch in Banjul bent...
text:
Op excursie vanuit Kololi naar Banjul deden we met onze privé-gids c.q. taxi-chauffeur ook deze attractie aan. Je kunt deels met de lift naar boven en deels met de trap.

Ze noemen het een National Center For Arts And Culture, maar het museum stelt weinig voor. Een enkele aangeklede pop, enkele vitrines en wat foto's. Dan houdt het wel op. Wel leuk om gezien te hebben, maar ik vond het uitzicht leuker.

Voor de prijs hoef je het niet te laten. Laten we het daar maar op houden.

title: De mooie omgeving van boven bekijken doe je op Arch 22
text: De Arch 22 is het symbool van de machtsovername op 22 juli 1994 en is een boogvormige toegangspoort tot de hoofdstad Banjul. De Arch 22 is 35 meter hoog en het hoogste gebouw van Gambia. Je kan gratis naar boven lopen (een lift is er ook), hier heb je een prachtig uitzicht over de stad, de omgeving, de oceaan en de Gambiarivier. Op het verkeersplein voor de boog staat het standbeeld van de onbekende soldaat, die een baby draagt. Een bezoek aan Arch 22 en naar boven lopen is zeker de moeite waard.

title: It's big and impressive
text: Built to commemorate the 22 July date of Independence, it is a striking landmark if not that beautiful so I don't think I would make a special visit

title: Stelt niets voor.
text: Bespaar je de moeite, er is weinig te zien. De bevolking, dorpen, markten zijn allemaal véél interessanter.

title: Great view from the arch
text:
The view from the arch is great and the history displayed inside is really interesting. 

Not the best thing to do in the Gambia, but worth a visit.

title: Beautiful view
text: For 50 dalasi, you get a tour of the arch all the way to the top, and an excellent view of Banjul. However the museum at the top is extremely underwhelming (for lack of a better word). Half of the exhibit was pushed to the side and looked as if no one had been there in decades, but the view definitely made up for it.

title: Lovely day out in Banjul
text: Took my Gambian fiancé out to Banjul for the day to do a bit of shopping and R&R. taxi dropped us off next to the roundabout opposite Arch22. we had a lovely stroll around and spent some time looking at the nice green spaces. unfortunately they had scaffolding up painting Arch22, but it was still lovely to look out. TIP1. Keep you valuables' secured as my camera was stolen not from Banjul has to be said. and TIP2  make sure if entering Banjul you have ID on you especially if you are in a mixed race couple like me. But don't let that put you off please. was still a nice day out and if you go down some of the side streets in Banjul you will find bargains a lot cheaper than the tourist areas

title: An adventure on its own!
text:
You pay a ridiculously cheap entrance fee to the guardian (the staff at the hotel said it was free...) and here you go, up the arch.
It was under renovation so it's a bit rough, you go through sand and over wheelbarrows. The view is incredible, and you have several points of view depending you stand on one side of the arch or the other and there is different heights. The view of the old town was my favorite.

title: A privat monument of the president.
text:
its build by the president Jamme and its his privat monument over him self. Its just a building and nothing speciell to se or do there. And the building is not fitting the in the area and to the other buildings in the area.
I can't recommend any to make a special visit just for this.

title: Mouldy Sandwich
text:
Give this place a miss 
We were served a sandwich. The bread was blue & Mouldy, never felt well after that experience

title: serves no purpose
text: Recently renovated for the 50th anniversary of independence. It doesn't seem to serve any purpose. The lift was not working and I could not go up the stairs. There is a low priced café/restaurant near it that serves good food and drinks. It only allows government vehicles to pass through.

title: Arch 22
text: A nice place for a short visit if based in Banjul as we were. Wouldn't bother, however, driving a long distance just for this. Freshly renovated for Feb 18th 50th Anniversary of Independence from Great Britain. Pleasant inexpensive cafe at its foot.

title: Stupid bit of minor megalomania
text: A big arch to celebrate another African dictator's reign.  Unlike statues this might not be demolished when he is finally toppled but it is hard to see a purpose for such a pointless building

title: A lot of steps for not a lot of view
text: Greeted by two lovely ladies and set the task of counting the steps to the top I was quite disappointed by the rather tatty 'museum' exhibits on the way up and not really knowing what to expect was quite underwhelmed by the view(s) from the top. Stupidly expecting some sort of award for counting the steps I was then delighted with the cafe/bar next door which had recently changed hands. The arch is really just a piece of ego massage for the president.

title: Nice arch, poor view
text: It is a very nice arch in a city that doesn't have a lot to offer. However, the views aren't all that special, as you may expect from the desolation of the Gambian landscape.

title: ARCH 22 IS OKAY
text:
There is nothing really serious about the arch 22. just that from the top you can have the are view of Banjul and is a sort of symbol for the the Gambia.

The museum is not that historical as an African, it may makes more meaning to the Amerians, Europeans, Caucasian, Asian etc.

But in all i rate 5/10

title: De pasada
text: Lo vimos de pasada, estaba con andamios. Lo que sí hicimos fue ir al Albert Market y también nos acercamos a coger el ferry a Barra y cruzar el río Gambia. Es un espectáculo ver el desembarco de este ferry así como montar en el. ¡A la carrera!

title: Ok
text: Great views from the top, but the 'museum' is woeful and some lighting in the stairs would have been nice

title: Good views
text: Worth the small entrance fee and climbing the stairs for the views from the top floors.  Some art and history displays to look at.  The building is poorly maintained, watch where your stepping and take care on the stairs.  Not one for very young children.

title: Новострой, но с музеем
text: Строение арки несколько выбивается из общей картинки Банжула - возможно, поэтому она и является его основной достопримечательностью. Внутри - небольшой музей с весьма посредственными экспонатами, зато есть возможность отдохнуть от жары и выпить кофе с видом на пыльный город.

title: Very talented
text: Sand pictures are excellent and you can order your own designs. A lovely selection of sizes and styles.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Worth a stop
text: Bakau is quite small and has limited tourist attractions but this place and the croc pool make it worth visiting. There are about 15 traders selling a range of local crafts - all very friendly and keen to help. Quality was reasonable and we were able to get a couple of really good deals - bartering is part of the process but good fun. Worth stopping if passing through Bakau.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good place to shop
text: We have visited the craft market plenty of times. They have a wide selection of handy craft and gifts. If there is something you would like but you can't see they will make it for you. It has a friendly atmosphere and it gives you chance to practice your bartering skills.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: trip with Habaib
text: brilliant, great experience at the market , lovely local crafts to buy . also walk along shores of Gambian river to see fishermen in action . Go with Habaib he will look after you show you things that the main trips perhaps wont

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Fun to walk around
text: We walked from our hotel to this market area.  It was interesting and easy to walk around with very little hassle.  Had a teak bread board made for us and it was delivered to hotel

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: anexperiace
text: well always go especially if you want to bring anything home be prepard to bargain dont pay any thing less than a third of the price they ask you for if they ask you for an offer go low and work from there if you like you can watch them making the things they sell it is fastinating just watching them i spent many a day watching the make stuff

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: A great place for children and those into arts and crafts.
text:
You could easily walk past this little shop with its corrugated iron walls and roof! It's situated right by the roundabout a Bakau craft market and next door to Saffie j restaurant.
The shop sells sand paintings which are I believe are all crafted on site, it also sells wooden carvings and paintings.
Our daughter first visited last year during a power cut but was invited inside to sit down and have a go at sand art for herself. She spent an hour making a very small picture by torch light.
This year she took lessons during the two weeks we were there. She learned all aspects of sand art and even how to dye the Sand!
She made a lovely picture during the time she spent there and also made a friend in Sheikh who was her teacher and is the son of the owner.
We paid 150 (£3) per hour and while she was busy with the sand we spent the time she was in there watching the world go by from Saffie j next door.
The day before we came home we were each given a bag of gifts by Sheikh and a lovely card. She was also given everything she needs to practice at home (including the different coloured sand hat she had prepared with him).
Please stop and have a look if you're passing this place, the amount of work that goes into these sand paintings is amazing. Have a couple of lessons and learn for yourself how it is done, it's worth every penny.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Want to see crocs? Well, you saw them. That’s it.
text: Maybe twenty or thirty lame crocs sleeping around or inside the pond. They do not move. You may even touch them. That’s it. You sat half an hour in the taxi to get there.

title: Small nice park
text:
A small park but very nice to see. Good price, 100 dalasi for one person. Worth a visit! 
Nice to see the crocodiles. Staff was good on the security.

title: Nice way to spend a few hours
text: We hired a taxi from our hotel to take us here nice little place to spend a few hours and you can touch the crocs if you dare, it’s only a couple of quid each to get in and has a little museum which was interesting

title: Kurzer Ausflug
text:
Von meinem Guesthouse aus, war der Park fußläufig zu erreichen. Eintritt kostet 100 D. Nach ein paar Metern ist man auch schon bei den Krokodilen, die man anfassen kann. Anschließend läuft man noch ein kleine Runde und bekommt Krokodileier gezeigt und wird um ein Spende gebeten. 
Insgesamt interessante Erfahrung.

title: Nice experience
text: A local taxi driver drove us to the place - the museum is very small, but the things on display are quite interesting. The pool itself and the opportunity to touch a crocodile - quite unique. The guys at the pool took good care that everyone had a chance to take a picture with an albino crocodile in a safe and organised manner. In general, a place to visit if you want to look the croc in the face :)

title: Be aware of pickpocketers
text: Took a guide from outside hotel. offered great information and we were guided through the museum followed by the elephant tree and the croc pool. While we did not have any issues we heard from other visiter their phones got stolen. Be aware.

title: Beautiful all round
text:
We visited the crocodile park with Black and White tours.
First there’s a history museum which was very interesting on the history of The Gambia, then a walk do to the crocodile pool.
Wow what lovely creatures.
With guidance we were able to have photographs with the crocodiles and learn how they live and eat.
Great trip all round

title: absolutly amazing xxx
text: my gambian friend took me to bakou with my other friends, I truly would urge anyone to visit and pledge a little donation to the guys whom keep these sacred reptiles from harm please donate if you visit as its an amazing expiriense Karen Soreadbury

title: Educational visit to a well managed and inexpensive nature site.
text:
After paying 100 dalasi each, we passed the small museum walking along a smooth shaded lane to the pool entrance.  Here we were met by the middle aged caretaker who gave us a 15 minute tour that included touching the back of a well fed male albino crocodile who was resting peacefully among 15 more of normal color. He showed a video of their morning feeding, tossing plump fish from a full wheelbarrow as the crocs emerged from the pool in increasing numbers. He then guided us along the pool trail pointing out the unapproachable aggressive females and several semi submerged crocs among the 80 that live around this pool. 
Further along, we stopped to admire an old Kapok with huge buttress roots when a monkey appeared that was nursing babies. Finally we were shown a rice field(matured at the end of the wet season) soon to be harvested and prepared for planting dry season vegetables. 
Before departing, we signed a book to make a small contribution to feeding the crocs.  
Delightful ½ hour visit.

title: ausbeutung : eintrittspreis 16€ in deutschland werde abkassiert aber nichts davon landet beim besitzer der farm
text: ich bin ziemlich sauer, dass hier eintrittspreise über dieses portal verkauft werden für 16€, aber der besitzer der krokodilfarm darüber gar keine kenntis hat. ich war vor ort der eintrittspreis liegt bei 2€ / 100  dalasi. davon bewirtschaftet er alles. von den 16€ kommt kein einziger ent bei denen an. ich frage mich, was das soll ????? mit welchem recht bereichern sich hier die deutschen an den sowieso schon armen menschen ? hier kostet ein brot 10 alasi / 18 cent. 16€ umgerechnet 878 dalasi, dann wäre hier jemand sehr reich. hier essen die bewohner mittags , nachmittags und abends reis , meist mit sauerampfer oder einer soße aus obst hergestellt. können sich keine milch und keine sonstiges gemüse / obst leisten. was sagt ihr alle dazu ? ich bin der meinung buchen ausschließlich dort bezahlen und bei 2€ sind spenden sehr gerne gesehen, wenn ihr die 16€ dann vor ort spendet, wisst ihr, dass das geld auch tatsächlich dort ankommt. anstehen muss hier keiner. das gilt übrifens auch für die sogenannten safaritouren, wo diese farm mit drin ist. ich hatte ein interview mit dem besitzer, daher weiß ich das. ich wollte nämlich wissen, was der eintritt kostet und ob ich noch wechseln gehen muss. nach diesem ergebnis war und bin ich immer noch zu tiefst entsetzt. das würde man sich in deutschland nicht wagen, da man auf schadensersatz klahgen kann. sich aber auf kosten von so armen menschen die taschen voll zu machen finde ich an dreistigkeit nicht zu überbieten.

title: Interessanter als gedacht
text:
Die meisten Touristen kommen hierher, um mal ein Krokodil zu streicheln - schon ein besonderes Erlebnis, wenn man die normalerweise vorhandene Aggressivität und Reaktionsschnelle der Tiere kennt.
Allerdings ist die Anlage auch seit Jahrhunderten eine Art Wallfahrtsort zu einer (nach wie vor vorhandenen) Heilquelle. Die Geschichte und Legende sollte man sich unbedingt zu Gemüte führen, dann ändert man vielleicht auch den Blick...
Das kleine Museum direkt nach dem Eingang vermittelt interessante Details über die Traditionen der verschiedenen Stämme Gambias.
Darüber hinaus kann man - wenn man mit entsprechend offenen Augen unterwegs ist - eine Vielzahl von Vögeln und mit Glück auch andere Tiere entdecken.

title: Highlight of our trip.
text: Loved it here. Great experience and the staff were brilliant. Highlight of our trip. Lovely museum with some interesting history.

title: Good for quick stop
text:
The entrance is just 100 dalasis to the museum which will tell you quite a lot about history of Gambia. There is also pretty good toilet. The “pool” is just a few seconds walk from the museum and it is “free” as it is included in museum fee. I am seriously against to touching while animals and make me sad that so many people taking “cool” photos while “sitting” on crocodiles. 
There are 3 parts … one where you can go to crocodiles very close and touch them. Pool where you can’t go close to them as they are aggressive (well that’s their nature right?) and then where you can see babies.  I have had great guy to talk to and we were joking and talking not just about crocodiles but life generally. You can contribute some money if you wish to keep this place running and I think it’s worth it

title: Don't Expect Much
text:
After visiting the Crocodile Pool. 

The Museum is small but very informative/interesting history of the Gambia. You will learn about the ancestral rituals, music, history of the British colonisation until recent days...By itself this was a good highlight for me.

The Crocodile Pool itself, is a rather muddy pool surrounded by trees and occupied by an assortment of tame crocodiles that do very little. Didnt take any photos with the crocodiles, because it didnt felt right for me.

It is an Okay way to spend an hour or two. Just don't expect a major tourist attraction

title: Enjoyed The Guided Tour
text: Take some fish with you and watch them been fed your offering, great guided tour and entertaining comments

title: We stroked a crocodile
text:
First there is some interesting museum
pieces about the tribes etc. Then you go to the pool. The guy who looks after the crocs really knows them well and you can tell he cares for them. You can stroke the crocodile under the supervision of their keeper. 
Plenty of opportunity to donate to the upkeep of the crocs. Don’t buy the exercise books on offer at the price they ask for, so much cheaper in the shops!

title: Interesting excursion
text: The site actually starts with a small museum with different rooms on Gambian culture - traditions, music, war etc. Then you go to see the crocodiles where the knowledgable keeper will tell you all about them and you can take photos. I think entry is 100D and then you can make a donation to the care of the crocodiles too. Good place to combine with other places to visit - we then went to Serekunda Market.

title: Tocar cocodrilos
text: Es una visita obligada si vienes a Gambia. Si tienes niños mejor. La visita comienza pasando por un pequeño museo de la historia de Bakau, donde puedes ver fotografías históricas y objetos tradicionales (trajes, tambores, jujus, etc…).  Muy espectacular un árbol pie de elefante que hay antes de llegar al recinto de los cocodrilos. Aunque la piscina de cocodrilos no tiene un tamaño muy espectacular, lo cierto es que lo compensan con la posibilidad de echarte fotos tocando los cocodrilos.

title: Close up experience
text: If you have never been close to animals like these before it's probably a life times experience for you, although they are so well fed they are not very active but it is possible to touch them which gives most people a thrill. Should visit this place if just for the historic connection of Katchikally.

title: Lots and lots of crocodiles including the elusive albino Charlie
text: This was a really bizarre experience. The guide was telling us that it was perfectly safe to stroke the crocodiles and have photos taken with them. The reptiles were practically comatose, now bearing in mind that they are cold blooded creatures, they should have been very lively indeed in a temperature of 34-36 degrees. When questioned about the state of their inertia we were told that they have been trained to only perceive fish as food, which l am sorry to say was a complete and utter load of Croc! They were undoubtedly sedated which was very sad to see and l and 1 other in our group refused to participate in such a farce.

title: Veel aanbieders, weinig toeristen
text: Veel standaard aanbod maar hier zitten ook de mannen die soms prachtige producten maken. Ik heb er nu twee keer een prachtige wandelstok laten maken. Prijzen zijn hoger als in serrekunda of banjul, maar natuurlijk onderhandelbaar

title: Heel doorsnee
text:
Een afgeschermde markt met zogenaamde Afrikaanse ambachtelijke producten maar alles wat je er ziet, zie je overal. Doorsnee houten beelden, doorsnee kralen, doorsnee sandalen, kortom alles doorsnee.
Het kost gelukkig niks om naar binnen te gaan.

title: Tourist junk
text: Just the usual tourist junk in a very depressing setting. Not much pressure from the traders, but we were there in the run-up to the state of emergency, so think most traders more concerned about the future. Hope all goes well for them.

title: Good selection items, lots of haggling
text: Visited twice, 1st time didnt make it past 1 stall before we spent up. 2nd time made past 2 or 3 then we'd bought what we went for. Lots of haggling to be done.

title: Eeg leuke markt
text: Toeristische markt maar wel erg leuk en gezellig. Vreselijke aardige verkopers ook als he alleen iets vraagt of wilt kijken. Natuurlijk willen ze graag allemaal wat verkopen maar het gaat op een vriendelijke manier.

title: Far to intence
text: I don't know if it is that im a swede but i feelt very uncomfortable at this market. We took two steps in and instantly about 10 people started to grab us och talk and pull just to look at their shop, and I totally understand that.  Still it feels far to tourist like. Everyone sells the same things, wooden statues and batik fabriks and sure they are beautiful, but they was manufactured. So, nothing special but if your looking for souvenires, this is the place.

title: Gezellige markt
text:
Leuke souveniertjes op deze houtsnij markt .
Mensen zijn wat opdringerig maar wel leuk en gezellig.
En ze kunnen maken wat je wil als je een voorbeeld hebt

title: Looking for African keepsakes
text:
Visited 2 days ago
As is usual no price tags pure barter system, felt slightly pressurised to buy things we were not interested in buying. Purchased lovely peanut cookies and oranges and bananas from lady I. The photo. I am going to call her big mama but I am sure she has another name.

title: So many stalls
text:
Objectively the vast majority of the stalls had all the same stuff, but that's not a problem. Don't try to go in all the stalls! Do go with the flow and let yourself be invited in to see the wares, the stall holders try very hard. Do play a game of Gambian mankala, you do have the time, and relax about it.
Do bargain well but politely, you will get a fair price.

title: buiten kun je niet zien hoe leuk het binnen is
text:
het is wel echt voor toeristen maar er zijn een aantal bijzonder aardige ondernemers binnen, zoals de kleermaker die achter de naaimachine zit in zijn kleine shop.
En helemaal achterin op nr 46 zit Bubba, een zeer vriendelijke jongen die niet opdringerig is en je kan laten zien hoe alles wordt gemaakt, je moet dan wel met hem mee naar achter het gebouw maar daar kun je zien hoe zijn houtsnijder de figuren ter plekke maakt.

title: Interesting
text: Lots of wood hand crafted items, nice souvenirs, but you need to negotiate for a reasonable price. The vendors will ask sometime ridiculous prices but if you stay strong you can get a good bargain.

title: Overwhelming at first
text:
There are some beautiful items available in this market but the constant hassle from the stallholders can make it difficult to focus on what is available.  I found it very overwhelming at first but grew to love it. Once you realise that they are genuinely just trying to make money to feed their families it becomes more understandable.

Some of the wood carvings are works of art. Clothes are a bit hit and miss but perfect for holidays. Great for little gifts. Prices are higher than other Gambian markets as it is a tourist area. Be prepared to haggle, it is half of the fun. Keep your money close to you and enjoy the atmosphere. I've had great fun with some of the stallholders while waiting for things to be made for me.

title: Wander after lunch
text:
Had a wander after lunch. 
You can have a great time and fun with the sellers but you need two things.

Be able to drive a hard bargain.

Have good communication skills and they are good sellers but also lovely.
Enjoy

title: Interesting but not best value
text:
The Positives:
Interesting area to browse and close to all the main Kololi hotels. Good range of crafts that make good tourist souvenirs. Interesting beak from hotel/pool/beach. 

The Negatives:
The merchandise is very tourist oriented and the best prices you can get here are much higher than you can get elsewhere. Some stall holders are too pushy - once you show even the slightest interest it is hard to get away without buying something. 

Overall, it is an interesting place to visit, but if you have the time, it is much better to visit Banjul market where you will find a much wider authentic range and get lower prices.

title: Nice things, but so much hassling
text: We didn't make it past the third stall - the sellers go hard here trying to sell all of their things. However, they did have some very nice things here. Be aware that you can easily buy everything for a third of the price that they're asking if you negotiate for a bit.

title: Heel erg rustig
text: Wij waren er rond 10 uur en er waren bij elkaar maar 8 toeristen. Het was veel van hetzelfde niks verrassend gezien

title: High pressure doesn't begin to describe it
text: We stopped in the evening to view the wares and were literally dragged into some stalls. We felt like we had fallen into a shark tank during a feeding frenzy.

title: Leuk markt
text:
Neem de tijd om deze markt te bezoeken
Ga in gesprek met de verkopers 
en wees correct dan zijn zij dat ook
Wel afdingen dan kom je op een prijs uit wat voor beiden partijen
acceptabel is.

title: Good selection of crafts
text: The craft market is convenient if you are staying in the Senegambia/Kololi area.  The selection is good and the vendors willing to negotiate.  They can be aggressive, but not as pressing as other places in Gambia.

title: Leuke uitstap
text:
Leuke toeristische plek om souvenirs te kopen !!!
Mooi om de plaatselijke kunstenaars aan het werk te zien met het maken van houtsnijwerk

title: Not what is advertised
text: Went here paid 900 dalasai  and saw none of the cheetah or lion or orphaned animal advertised on the pamphlet. Don't know if there are 2 eagle heights but definatly not what is advertised on their pamphlet. There was some old hyenas and a few monkeys caged up. Guide was quite good in pointing out birds and wildlife but as per usual in Gambia expects a tip.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Abuko and Eagle heights conservation reserves
text: Seeing the monkeys and crocodiles different bird's and hyena and going to Eagle heights conservation area where they are trying to breed the cheetah that they bought over with them from their park in Kent England not far from where we live.... And seeing the beautiful lion cub Buba and hope that next time we visit we see it in a lovely natural enclosure and possibly with a mate....

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Worth a Short Trip, but Don't do 2 hours
text: Parts of this place are very cool, such as what they called the orphanage where you can see hyenas and lots of monkeys. Other parts are a bit boring. I would recommend having your car take you all the way into the orphanage rather than doing a 1 or 2 hour walk around the reserve. You can buy peanuts or bananas to feed to the monkeys at the orphanage, and that was quite fun.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: overrated
text: We went, payed 400 dalasis each and 200 for a guide who did not tell us much. Just walked arround. Didn't spot a lot of birds but we didn't go at the good birdtime :) and if there were any our guide did not point them out. Also went to the zoo, there was a lion in a really really small cage. The birds were strapped and couldn't fly so i didn't like it!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Leuk natuurpark, maar zie het niet als safari
text: Mooi en leuk natuurpark met een grote vijver waarin een krokodil zit. Verder kunnen de lokalen je vertellen over de slangen, andere dieren en bomen. De nieuwe vogelshow, uitgevoerd door Engelsen, is ook echt de moeite waard

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Warning! Reserve Now Occupied by Unmonitored Scammer Bumsters!
text:
The Abuko Nature Reserve is a large forest protected by the Government of The Gambia. It was once developed and maintained by the University of Warwick in the UK as a Darwin Field Station for biodiversity study, a project that ended in 2005. Since then, the developed portions of the Reserve have been abandoned and taken over by "bumsters" who know nothing about nature or biodiversity, but have figured out a number of scams to take your money. 

For example, the true entry fee for the park is 15 Dalasis as shown on the official receipt you are given...upon payment of 400 Dalasis!. In my case, I did not notice the receipt until I had paid the 400 Dalasis...too late sucker! Mysteriously, I was given a sticker to enter a privately owned exotic animal zoo on the highway outside of the park as a consolation. These "proprietors" apparently figured out an arrangement with the owners of the zoo to sell entry to that separate enterprise, off-site, under the guise that it was a mandatory fee to enter the Reserve. I was then asked for another 100 Dalasis to rent a pair of binoculars with no strap. I later found that the 10 X 50 glasses had been dropped and damaged so that the mirror prisms inside had been knocked out of alignment rendering them useless. Inasmuch as they were extremely heavy and without a strap, I simply pitched them into my sack and carried on with my own self-guided walk through the pathways of the Reserve. 

I respectfully declined the extremely high pressure mandatory but voluntary but mandatory requirement to hire a guide for another 300 Dalasis because I did not want to be accompanied by an unofficial "guide" who knew nothing about the faunna, flora and wildlife except what one could see anyway with the naked eye. The last thing I wanted was someone talking to me incessantly for the duration of my experience which did turn out to be a very beautiful 2-hour stroll through a luxurant forest full of wildlife. 

About halfway into the Park, I came across the remains of the Darwin Biodiversity Field Station which is adorned with old rotting posters and two bumsters dressed in disco garb and sunglasses who, not surprisingly, were requesting more "donations." They presented a "guestbook" that was undated, but appeared to be signed by people who were donating up to 500 Dalasis for a project that unbeknownst to them was terminated in 2005. The donation box was not only unlocked, but it had disappeared with the slot simply allowing the money to fall on the floor. When I asked who would get the money, the "boys," probably in their late 20s,  stated that the money would go to "the man." The station had some displays of bones that the boys had collected in the forest, lying on a table, and the remnants of old biodiversity exhibits. This field station offered no information about what was going on in the park. 

Notably, no one in the park, at the entrance or at this field station, could sell me a simple map of the park. For all the come-ons for money, one would have thought the easiest sell would have been a map of the park itself so that patrons like myself could find their way around the winding pathways, as obvious as they are. But then, enabled with a map, who would need a guide? This was a very simple thing to prepare and distribute for which I would have paid gladly. The absence of maps ws designed to compel the purchase of a guide. Who wants foreign visitors to have a pleasant walk through the park on their own? Certainly the proprietors do not. 

Nevertheless, continuing on from the field station, I had an extremely pleasant experience noting crocodiles, many more exotic birds than I had anticipated, and plenty of monkeys. It truly is a beautiful experience if you would like to take a walk for a couple of hours on your own. At all costs, however, I would avoid the sucker plays of everyone who is offering you something for money, especially their delightful company and incessant banter while you are trying to listen to the nature and take it all in. 

Near end of the pathway on the interior of the park there is what appears to be a legitimate zoo which contains hyenas, baboons and wild monkeys. These animals are kept in these cages on the explanation that they were once domesticated and the proprietors are attempting to allow them to re-adapt to their natural environment. They would be released in six months. I cannot imagine who would have domesticated the hyenas that I saw in those cages. They were huge! Domesticated baboons? Finally, the exit trail leads you onto, of all place,  the main highway far from your starting point. There you will find the UK owned zoo that contains some exotic animals outside of their natural habitat such as lions and cheetahs. Although I had unwittingly been forced to pay for entry into the Reserve, I passed on the idea, walked down the driveway onto the main highway, and then walked about three quarters of a kilometer down the highway to reunite with my vehicle at the entry of the park. It seemed an odd configuration to enter at one end, and then be dumped onto a main highway only to walk along noisy and fierce traffic to get back to your starting point. 

In the end, I did enjoy the walk and the exposure to nature that I found there. I'm afraid, however, that the fact that it has been spoiled by fraudulent tricks and and parasitic squatters who have taken over a once well-maintained biodiversity project assured me that I would not return to this place. Left alone, it is a beautiful place. Unfortunately, it is been spoiled by the unnatural. There are many other better maintained or unmaintained nature reserves in The Gambia that are well worth my time and money. Be forewarned!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: eagle heights
text: went to abuko to a place called eagle heights,this is owned by English,they do flying displays and are very informative,but their main aim is conservation ang getting wildlife back into gambia,we did a walk with ba ba the lion cub which was amazing so please visit and support wildlife is dying out

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Saw some amazing wildlife.
text: Hired our own guide for a walk around this very manageable wildlife park. Saw some memorable sights including crocodiles, pygmy bee eaters, fire-finches and an African darter. There is a rather sad zoo towards the rear of the park where there are one or two sorry looking hyenas and baboons but I understand that the plan is to improve this facility in conjunction with the near-by Eagle Heights Park which is also worth a visit.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: wildlife Gem
text: This is a huge nature park.  It has fascinating flora and fauna. If you are a nature lover with an interest in birds, it's a must! We were lucky enough to see two species of Deer and crocodiles - spotted by our eagle eyed bird guide, Ansu Dunor.  I cannot recommend him highly enough.  He was very patient with us and wished to ensure we saw as much as possible. Beware of fake guides - to ensure a good guide, we recommend you ask for Ansu at the Bird Watchers Association located next to the Bridge in Kotu.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Something Old something New
text: This new nature site is at Abuko Nature Reserve,it is called EAGLE   Heights it says"face to face with nature" and so it is the people want to try and bring back some of the animals that Human beings over the years have destroyed eg Cheetars, (they have a cub) brings tears to your eyes.Lions, different birds  of prayand so much more, but they need our help so please visit and see what they have done in a short time, there are toilets, some benches under trees to drink cold Coke, water etc.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Very Highly Recommended
text: Excellent and very knowledgeable guide Ismaela showed us many animals and kept us save as he walked with us around the park.  He took us on a long tour and allowed us to borrow his binoculars to view the crocodiles and kingfishers around the water.  We also saw vultures, ospreys, termite mounds, bushbuck antelopes and inside the Eagle Heights Centre (which is within the Abuko Nature Reserve) we saw baby vultures, tortoises, birds of prey, a lion cub called Babar and even a cheetah couple!  Very educational and the conservation work they are doing here is excellent.  The animals are very well looked after and if any are in cages this is only ever for breeding or rehabilitation purposes.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: was so peaceful
text: was so peaceful and amazing all at the same time worth a visit, for a tour and culture and traditions and seeing the baboo's

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Loved it!
text: A real feel of African wild life. Animal sighting and nature- great way to spend your day if you're bored of sitting by the pool (don't get me wrong, I still got a tan that day). At times it look like scenes from Lost. Would do it again!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Abuko
text: Rather run down and avaricious staff. Over rated: we were taken to far better bird watching sites than this one, well regarded as it once was.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Worth a visit if you are a bird watcher
text: We had no interest whatsoever in the orphanage, only going for the birds. We hired a guide locally and spent a pleasant few hours walking around the reserve and added quite a few birds to our list. We also saw colobus and green vervet monkeys plus a couple of crocs. Maybenot worth visiting if you are not Into birdwatching, though the walk is pleasant enough.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Waste of time
text:
Arrived here early afternoon. As we didn't have much time, our driver wanted to drive us to the centre to see the hyenas & feed the monkeys. We have been a few times in the past, many years ago & had a good time, although I was never too keen on the condition the animals were kept in. We were taking friends out for a day & thought it would be nice to visit. 

On arrival our driver enquired about the price & said we just wanted to drive straight into the centre. He was told its 400 d each!!!! And we had to take a guide for the walk through the forest. I understand this is the guides only mean of income but we didn't want to do the walk, we've never had this problem before. We explained we only wanted to see the centre but was told we had to do all if it so we got back in the car. The man came over & said ok what will you pay for what you want to do. I said it's too late, as he was being greedy we would just go to lamin lodge for a drink. Bad luck, you lost out. 

Some other friends of ours did visit, on my recommendation (from past experiences) they said it was extremely overpriced, the animals were in appalling conditions & overall it was rubbish. Sorry guys, had I known how badly it had gone down hill & how expensive it was I would have told them not to bother. 

Stick to the crocodile pond at 50d each.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Beautiful nature walk
text: The walk is wonderful, shame there were too many noisy tourists scaring the crocs away! A guide named Billy had excellent knowledge, I felt it a real Shame that these guides are not employed by the park which is government owned & it's quite expensive compared to other tourist attractions in Gambia, so it was shocking to me that Billy only got paid the tips! There was a very wounded hyena which was a little concerning, apparently he had fought with the others. All other animals seemed happy & healthy. Eagle heights is very new & therefore they don't have many animals to see but the staff are very knowledgeable.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A must see
text: A great way to see animals in rehabilitation, be prepared for the long walk through the forest. There are Cheetahs, crocodiles, birds, hawks, monkeys etc to see, worth a visit.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Vile disgusting place
text: This part is written for the government own part of the so called nature reserve. We went with Thomas cook who had it advertised as a National park and Animal orphanage. Never seen animals is such appalling conditions, no clean water, Hyenas that were so mange ridden it must of been awful for them in the heat. A monkey in a cage that was paralysed from the waist down, had to drag himself to the food, questioned the keepers who lied and said it only arrived the previous day, which later was found not to be true it had been like it for over a month, I offered to pay for the vet to come out and humanly put it to sleep!!!!!!!. It is not an orphanage it is cruelty beyond believe. !!!!!!!

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Recomend this attraction
text: When you have paid in you feel a little pressure to put more money in the donation box and the man at the gate follows you and show this to you which i think is unnecessary. apart form this it is well worth the visit.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Leuke lokale markt
text: Het is echt Afrikaans, ze proberen je alles te verkopen. Gewoon duidelijk zijn en niks beloven. Dan blijft het ook leuk.

title: Shopping for souvenirs
text: If you can ignore the hassle this is a lovely place to shop. Much less hassle than at other craft markets. Most stalls will find you whatever you want if you can't see it.

title: Leuke markt voor souvenirs
text: Leuke, kleine  markt. Aardige mensen waar ik veel lol mee heb gehad. Ik heb daar heel veel houtsnijwerk gehaald en altijd netjes mijn kleingeld ontvangen. Ben je in Gambia en wil je leuke souvenirs scoren dan raad ik je aan deze markt te bezoeken. Vergeet niet af te dingen. Vinden ze leuk.

title: Onze eerste ervaring
text:
Wees op je hoede hier, je bent altijd eerste klant en wisselgeld is er niet. In plaats daarvan kan je iets anders uitzoeken en eventueel bijbetalen. 
Geen goede eerste kennismaking met Gambia

title: Een gewone lokale markt is goedkoper en afwisselender
text: Verleden jaar een lange broek daar gekocht die ik 10 minuten aangehad heb, daarna zat er een scheur in. Deze scheur laten maken, maar de broek bleek verteerd. Na 3 x uit elkaar vallen hebben we het opgegeven. Dit jaar daar 1 blouse gekocht 700 Dalassies. Op de gewone markt kochten we er 2 voor 500

title: Craft market
text: I enjoyed the hustle bustle of the market. I saw and bought many different crafts as well as getting my hair braided. The only downside is the relentless badgering of the vendors to get you to buy their wares........which is understandable but became tiresome.

title: Easy to get to but a bit over-rated...
text: Don't really buy tourist bling and do consider a lot this is actually mass produced somewhere else. Colourful and worth a few selfie photos.  A taxi ride into Serekunda will get you to a genuine Gambian trading market, realistic prices, be prepared to haggle and ask the ladies before you take photo.

title: Leuk voor wie het eerst in Afrika komt
text: Een markt  vol met Afrikaanse kleding en handwerk. Leuk voor wie een snuisterijtje wilt kopen. Helaas word je het al snel zat, omdat je geen stap meer kunt zetten tot er weer iemand in je nek springt om wat te kopen en daarover door blijft zaniken. Ikzelf vond dat vrij hinderlijk. Je moet ook goed tegen de "pingelcultuur" kunnen. Dit spel van overvragen en afdingen moet je echt liggen. Mij boeide het niet zo. Mijn vrouw was er gek op. Het is dus persoonlijk. Let er in ieder geval op geen te grote of te zware dingen te kopen zoals houtsnijwerk, want je zit met je bagagelimiet op het vliegveld. Er zit ook veel kwaliteitsverschil in de batic kleding zo hebben we gemerkt na een handwasje op de hotelkamer. Maar wat nu wel of niet goed is, daar kan ik helaas niet in adviseren.

title: Better elsewhere in Gambia
text:
The Senegambia craft market is at the left when entering the Senegambia strip, the sellers were rather pushy during this low season.
Lots of things to buy, ideal for those who don't like to leave the strip.
Prices are higher than at other places. Dark during evenings.
Try the Brikama craft market, and you will be impressed

title: Market visit.
text: Nice market with a lot of shops. They all have there own handcrafted materials. You can see nice woodwork, cloth and other things. Try the  juices at the main gate.

title: If you need anything before going back, you find it here
text: If you need anuthing to buy before going home, go there. Everything is hathered under the same roof. Remember dealing! Not the price they give to you, it's like auction

title: Laat je niet dwingen maar geniet van de African Way of shopping.
text: Superleuke Market met honderden kraampjes die natuurlijk allemaal iets aan je willen verkopen. Blijf beleefd en doe vooral je eigen ding in dit koopjesparadijs.

title: Doolhof
text: Heel groot en je zou er kunnen verdwalen. Van alles te koop. een aanrader als je de lokalen wilt zien inkopen.

title: Lots of little things to buy for familly and friends
text: Nice little market with jewary bags that kind of stuff just off the strip very busy so keep an eye on you bags nice people.

title: een echte toeristenval
text: Prijzen zijn veel duurder dan op de markt in serrekunda. De verkopers zijn ERG opdringerig. niet echt het bezoeken waard.

title: interesting caft market, nice place to visit
text: like all other gambian craft markets we can find a bit of all hand made jewellery, bags and colourfull clothes, people are very friendly and its well located at the center of Senegâmbia.

title: Very Interesting Market for Loacl Handicraft.
text:
There are many small stalls displaying hand crafted goods. Some of the carving is superb and very cheap considering the work that has gone into it.
There are of course many trinkets, drums, local clothes, carvings etc.
The people there are extremely friendly and desperate for you to buy from them, without being pushy.
A very interesting place to vist.

title: Lively market
text: Good busy and buzzy market. Very enthusiastic stall owners willing to do a deal ! Rather large too. Loads of different stalls and lovely colours abound. See the fish etc etc.

title: Nie bardzo duży market w centrum
text: Market, który da się w miare szybko przejsc i sie nie zgubić. Ludzie nagabują ale tak jest wszędzie. Pamiątki głównie materiały, koszulki, spodnie, parea, biżuteria (rózne bransoleteczki naszyjniki) i maski na ścianę. Produktów spozywczych regionalnych nie ma.

title: Matkamuistojen shoppailuun, mutta myyjät ovat hieman päällekäyviä
text:
Tämä on hyvä paikka käydä hakemassa matkamuistoja kotiin, sillä sieltä löytää niin koruja, käsintehtyjä puutuotteita kuin vaikkapa rumpuja. Muista tingata hyvin!

Myyjät ovat hieman liian innokkaita myymään ja tällaiselle suomalaiselle se tuntuu aika oudolta...

title: Barely worth the bother
text:
The grandiose Arch was built to commemorate the coming to power of H.E. Sheikh Professor Alhaji Dr. Yahya A.J.J. Jammeh,
President of the Republic of The Gambia and Commander-In-Chief of the Gambia Armed Forces.

In a country that has so much poverty, this structure seems both unnecessary and ill-advised.

Tourists can ascend the Arch in a lift. There is a moderately-interesting museum near the top and you certainly get some good views over the town and surrounding countryside. However, there are better museums (e.g. Katchikalli) and better roof-top views (e.g. Bakau Guest House), so I really can't recommend this.

title: Boored me...
text:
Thinking of Arch de Triump, the view is nice but the stairs and interior is so boring... 

If you are there.. go for the view and only that..

title: Excellent customer service
text: Our roots trip did not happen due to a administrative error, however the CEO Abdul apologized personally and offered for us to go on the next trip for free, however we would be leaving the Gambia on that day. Instead he gave us a free trip of what we wanted to do we chose to go to the crocodile and monkey park with a personal guide and free water thrown in. I would have no hesitation to recommend or use Arch tours again.

title: Interesting
text: An interesting landmark.  Unfortunately, marking the President - who himself has some very controversial views on the world.  Dirty, and dusty and not particularly well looked after.

title: Good view
text: the view over banjul was brill, entrance fee was very cheap less than 50p theres a small museum inside which is interesting, and when you come down across the road is billys bar where they sell good cold cheap drinks service with a smile.

title: nice view
text: Grand Arch built for the president the only problem is only the president can drive through it .This causes a huge bottleneck of local traffic because it spans the main road !

title: 4 in 1 tour is geweldig!
text: Nogmaals dankje wel Amy en ibrama voor de geweldige excursie die jullie ons bezorgd hebben.Ook de chauffeur niet te vergeten. Het is prachtige excursie, je ziet in 1 dag ontzettend veel hierdoor krijg je snel een goed beeld van Gambia.De gidsen zorgen goed voor je en vertellen veel! Als we volgend jaar weer gaan dan zou zomaar nog eens een zelfde tour willen doen zo leuk was het!

title: Very Interest
text: Quite a lot of stairs to climb but its worth the walk.  The top floor has a little bit of information about Gambia and its history and the view are great

title: Highly recommended for your excursions
text: All the staff were brilliant, they looked after us all (7 in our party) superbly well. They were informative, we enjoyed their company so much that we asked for the same guides again.

title: fantastic set up
text: Excellent value, Knowledgeable and friendly guides, reliable and punctual. Had to cancel one trip on the actual morning of the trip due to onset of Banjul Belly, and they gave a full refund with no quibbles.

title: Łuk Prezydencki
text: Warto tam wejść fajne widoki. Sam łuk to żadna atrakcja ale jak już się jest w Banjul naprawdę warto wejść koszt to 50 dalasi

title: de presidents boog
text: Leuk om te zien en zeker de moeite van het beklimmen waard,want van boven af kun je goed zien dat Gambia een eiland is ,halverwege de boog is een kleinezaal ingericht met historische spullen

title: Ok
text: Went as I didn't want to miss any thing , used the lift on way that was scaring in its self , only took 5 minute to look around ( we didn't think much of it ) we went out side to take photos wow that was lovely to see the whole city , we walk down when finish it was dirty and un kept , all in all ok for photos that all .

title: Good and bad makes average
text: Looking the Arch from a distance makes it attractive to visit this monument. I don't judge the architecture here, since this is a personal taste. Banjul doesn't have many high buildings, so the Arch is about the only monument to overview the city and the direct neighborhood. Positive is the nice view; negative is the absolutely insufficiently maintained art exposition inside. Better to show nothing, than showing this sad collection. Better to concentrate the art work in the Banjul museum?

title: Wunderschöner Ausblick auf Banjul vom etwas in die Jahre gekommenen Denkmal
text:
Wer mit der Taschenlampe den Weg auf die Aussichtsplattform gefunden hat, wird mit einem imposanten Ausblick auf Banjul belohnt. Ansonsten kann man sich das kleine Museum im oberen Teil anschauen.
Vor der Benutzung der Fahstuhl sei gewarnt - man kann zwar die Tür öffnen, schaut aber nur in den offen Schacht drei Stockwerke in die Tiefe...

title: Well worth a visit
text: Historical artefacts, costumes, traditional personal items, masks, bad ju ju area, lots of interesting things to see and read about. The viewing tower is good for a view of banjul. Take your Gambian friends, I doubt if they will have been by themselves, I'm sure they will enjoy the visit. Soft drinks can be bought from the cafe/ restaurant.the entry fee is nominal, and is much lower for Gambians. There are clean rest room facilities. Well worth a visit.

title: Great views
text: Cheap to go in and an option of lift or stairs to the top. Once at the top you have great views of Banjul and beyond. There is a small museum at the top which although isn't bursting with items, it does give you a good insight to the history of Gambia. Make sure you take a camera because there is nowhere else in Gambia where you can get views like this.

title: worth a visit if your in banjul
text: Don't go out of your way especially for this one - but there is a little museum and art gallery. £1 entrance fee and good views from the top

title: Strange national structure
text: Interesting to see some of the Gambian political history. Good views. Don't make a special journey just for thi, but worth it if you're wandering g round Banjul for the day

title: amazing senegal
text: alles was top; onthaal, locatie, eten, excursies vriendelijke mensen ,eigenares belgische jonge lieve dame Karolien en haar team ; gewoon ernaartoegaan en genieten ;;;;anne en co

title: Interesting museum and crocodile pool
text:
Place was easy to locate - look out for the colorful wall 
It cost $100 to visit the museum and pool 
Although museum was small it had a lot of info about the music, culture, women, history and nature of Gambia 
Thé croc pool was small but interesting as gâtés were left open 
You are encouraged to wander inside, with guide to bring you close to them which we declined 

We prefer to let sleeping crocodiles alone 

The kids were more aggressive though - with endless demands for soccer balls, physical items, money and all things under the sum. 
Watch out for them instead.

title: ... recht kurzes aber einmaliges Vergnügen
text:
Überraschender Weise war es tatsächlich ein recht kurzes Vergnügen. Der angepriesene Krokodil-Pool entpuppt sich als doch recht kleiner Teich mit vielen Krokodilen. Gott sei Dank sind alle recht gut gefüttert, quasi satt, so dass wir die draußen rumliegenden Krokodile ohne Angst streicheln/anfassen konnten. 
Anbei ist noch ein kleines Museum zur Geschichte von Gambia.
Alles in allem war es ein ganz ordentlicher Ausflug, zumal auf dem Hin- und Rückweg, quer durch die anliegenden Dörfer, zusätzlich noch ein Einblick zur Lebensweise der Gambianer gewonnen werden kann.
Bezahlt haben wir dafür umgerechnet 60 €.

title: Superbe expérience
text: Incontournable pour une visite de Banjul car expérience incroyable. Vous ne risquez absolument rien et pourtant je n'étais pas convaincue. Les guides sont très sympas et vous rassureront si vous avez encore des réticences. A faire absolument. 100D, c'est donné donc une petite donation s'impose:)

title: Divertente!
text:
Un piccolo museo, un percorso nella foresta e questa pozza in cui vivono coccodrilli che si possono toccare. In effetti è abbastanza strano, ma li abbiamo toccati tutti 🤷🏼‍♀️. La leggenda dice che chi si bagna nelle sue acque riceve figli o fortuna, a seconda di ciò che desidera. Naturalmente non si può entrare dentro, un addetto recupera un secchio d'acqua se glielo chiedi. 
I dintorni cozzano un po' con questa zona turistica. Discarica a cielo aperto, fogne a cielo aperto, tanta povertà.. mio marito, gambiano lui stesso, c'è rimasto male.

title: Filthy pool, to many crocs in a to small environment
text: The reason we went there is the small museum. There you can learn about the culture, especially Mandinka, but also about history. We loved it

title: Strange, different but wonderful!!
text:
What a great place! This is not a zoo, this is where the crocodiles choose to stay and live, they are free to leave if they want, we loved to see this natural place and pool and the crocodiles are very calm, looks peaceful!
Ask your guide and they will help you! Count on about 2 hours to walk around! Bring some cash and give about 5-10€ in tip inside to the crocodile manager, the money is for fish to feed the crocodiles in the mornings!
Well worth the time and that small amount of money!

title: Śpiące krokodyle
text:
W porze suchej dla krokodyli jest za gorąco. Śpią w cieniu. Można je spokojnie dotknąć (pod nadzorem).
Dziwne uczucie. Na żart mojej żony "że chyba są z plastkiku"-pan sie zdenerwował i złapał gada za ogon i zaczął ciągną. Ten sie obudził , wyrwał i uciekł do wody.

title: Nærkontakt med krokodiller
text: Her kan du gå rundt et lite tjern der det er fullt av krokodiller 2-3 meter lange. Man må gå med en guide som kjenner krokodillene og vet hvilke som er agressive og hvilke som er rolige. Man har også muligheten til å klappe en stor krokodille. Det er altså ingen gjerder eller stengsler mellom besøkende og krokodillene. Det har visstnok kke vært noen uønskede hendelser, men dette synes jeg var veldig ubehagelig. Er det virkelig trygt? Og har de gjort noe med krokodillene for at de skal holde seg rolige? Ikke vet jeg, men jeg skal ihvertfall ikke tilbake hit.

title: Crocodile Park
text:
I visited the crocodile park. I found the Museum small but very informative with a lot of history.
I was shocked to see a crocodile just lay in the park, unmoving with its mouth wide open, the only thing that moved was its eyes, it must surly be drugged to stay like this. I did have a photo taken with it, like every one else but I now wish I hadn't

title: Tegen betaling van 100 dalasi een krokodil aaien... tja
text:
Entree 100 dalasi. Aaien krokodil (wachtrij, super commercieel) nog 100 dalasi.

Er is vanaf de entree eerst een best aardig museum waar je doorheen loopt over de geschiedenis van Gambia. Als je met je eigen taxichauffeur komt (hij mag gratis naar binnen) kan die wat meer uitleg geven. Daarna loop je een soort klein park in met een meertje waar wat krokodillen in/naast liggen. Als je er een (die geen vlees maar vis eet) wil aaien moet je in de rij op je beurt wachten. Na het aaien moet je je naam in een boek zetten en betalen. In een half uur sta je weer buiten.

De "pool" ligt in een arme wijk, kinderen stormen op je af zodra je de taxi uit stapt. Neem wat verpakte koekjes, snoepjes of lollies mee... daar zijn ze erg blij mee.

title: Z gadami
text: Bardzo ciekawe miejsce, krokodyle swobodnie bez klatek wylegują się na polanie aTy możesz go dotknąć byle nie w głowę. Polecam

title: Crocs up close
text: Great to be able to touch these terrifying animals. Amazing to see up close. and in a natural environment.

title: Krokodillen
text: Met onze prive gids heeft hij ons een rondleiding gegeven. Als 1e een stuk geschiedenis over Gambia. Erg interessant en merkt ook emotie bij de gids. Vervolgens naar de krokodillen. Ze krijgen vis te eten i.p.v. vlees waardoor ze rustig worden en niet agressief. Jaja hierdoor kan je ze aanraken. Vond het wel even eng maar blij dat ik het gedaan heb. Je deed dit samen met de man die daar werkt en ook leuke verhalen verteld en van humor houdt.

title: Inget att besöka
text: Inte värt ett besök, var krokodilerna drogade?? De mest intressanta var att vi gick hem efter besöket hos crocsen, rekommenderas att gå genom området för att få träffa lokal befolkningen. Det är fritt att gå i parken, man måste inte anlita en guide, vilket dom gärna vill att man gör.

title: Great place
text:
Well there can’t be many places in the world where you can have your photo taken stroking a crocodile.
The history of this sacred pool is very interesting and being so close to the crocodiles is an amazing experience.

title: Krokodillen zijn wel lieve beestjes!
text: Bezoek met plaatselijke gids. Eerst het museum met wat geschiedenis, voodoorituelen en plaatselijke muziekinstrumenten. Daarna een wandeling door wat bos en plots sta je tussen een hoop krokodillen die ervan genieten om geaaid en gemasseerd te worden. Een leuke ervaring.

title: If you have never seen a croc....
text:
If you have seen crocs before: Don't go!
If you have not and are with children: You might consider!
If you go alone: Take a taxi! The streets to the Pool are narrow, dirty and VERY lokal.

title: Spotkanie z krokodylem
text:
Zobaczysz oraz dotkniesz krokodyla w tym parku. Krokodyle chodzą swobodnie po obiekcie bez klatek oraz bez terrariów. Gady karmione są rybami przez obsługę. W porze suchej krokodyle nie wykazuj dużej aktywności, w przeciwieństwie do pory deszczowej gdzie ich aktywność znacznie wzrasta.
Polecam wycieczkę z lokalnym przewodnikiem:
Travor J,  WhatsApp number +2203113578
https://pl.tripadvisor.com/Profile/alasanaj2020?fid=04065aa2-e2d1-4f07-b51d-c20a68cfbf31

You will see and touch a crocodile in this park. Crocodiles walk freely around the object without cages and without terrariums. The reptiles are fed by fish by service. In the dry season, crocodiles do not show much activity, unlike the rainy season, where their activity increases significantly.
I recommend a trip with a local guide:
Travor J,  WhatsApp number +2203113578
https://pl.tripadvisor.com/Profile/alasanaj2020?fid=04065aa2-e2d1-4f07-b51d-c20a68cfbf31

title: Dichtbij de krokodillen
text: Een klein museum over de voodoo van Gambia en muziekinstrumenten en een poel vol krokodillen. Leuk om te zien.

title: krokodillen aaien
text: Leuke excursie in Gambia met krokodillen aaien als hoogtepunt, ook een leuk klein museum ophet terrein aanwezig

title: Interesting and busy
text: Go here to see some of the local life and understand how life in a third world country can be. Bring a guie or a trusted local if you feel insecure when being approached by bumsters. Most people here are really nice. Ask before taking pictures, som people will say no, ofters will be happy to pose for you (and do not charge). Some will even encourage you to take pictures of or with them. Be aware that this is a busy and sometimes dirty and smelly place so do not dress in your best clothes.

title: Hyperdrukke markt in het centum van Banjul
text: Je moet stevig in je schoenen staan, iedereen wil natuurlijk iets van je maar als je doorzet krijg je een fraaie inkijk op de dagelijkse gekte van deze markt.

title: Kleurrijk
text: Leuke markt waar je als toerist leuke dingen kunt kopen. Wel afdingen. Loop ook over de levensmiddelen markt, deze is wat authentieker.

title: Give it a try
text: Orderly and easy to navigate.  Alot better and cleaner than the market in serekunda. IF you are looking for it most likely it is in albert market, and the prices are reasonable.

title: Worth a visit if you are in Banjul
text:
We visited as a couple but with a guide - so pleased we did as I imagine I might get lost in the alley ways. Our guide also assisted us in taking photographs - the locals were not keen on the camera - but he stopped at a few stalls and bought some fresh ingredients for his evening meal - as he got into conversation with the stall holders we were then able to take some candid shots without offending. 
It's a warren of narrow allies, some stalls covered with bright sun umbrellas and some stalls in the covered market. All sorts on sale from the enormous smoked fish being sold from a wheel barrow to Sunday dresses and flip flops. Of course the usual fruit and veg. 
It's even possible to have a shirt tailor-made - several guys working away at their sewing machines at the back of the market. 
We spent half an hour here - could have easily stayed longer

title: Good local market
text: While the Albert market does have its share of mask/souvenir shops it is also a place for locals with fish, vegetables, fruits, ancient grains and prepared foods on offer.  It is not particularly clean but it was not intimidating at all.  We were happy to be in a place that did not feel like it was only for tourists.

title: Not as full-on as serrekunda
text: And thats a good thing sometimes. Albert Market has all the usual tourist-trap shops but is a working market and caters to the locals' needs, both domestic and commercial. A must is the fishing-village part just around the corner form the market - again, a real, working place, tricky to walk around but an essential visit if you want to experience something other than hordes of tourists clicking away.

title: The real gambia
text: Instead of the serrekunda market we went with our driver to albert market. Which is in the middle of the city center. They have various little shop. Dont expect to much. You see gambian selling food, fruit and clothes. You see the normal day of life where the heart beats. Also close to the ferries.

title: Koe aidot afrikkalaiset markkinat!
text: Kannattaa ehdottomasti käydä pääkaupungin suurimmilla markkinoilla Albert Marketissa ja tutustua markkinoiden tarjontaa, tinkimistä unohtamatta! Myyjän antamasta ensimmäisestä hinnasta voi tinkiä 40-50% pois.

title: Drukke gezellige markt
text: Met Falutours deze trip gemaakt. Eerst op Serrekunda markt geweest, deze markt is heel anders, veel kleding te koop maar heel gezellig

title: Jobbigt och rörigt
text: Barnen tyckte det var hemskt, jag också. Folk drog i en, en del blev sura och arga för att man inte besökte deras stånd. Väldigt smutsigt, obehaglig stämning, trångt och rörigt. En väldig labyrint och helt plötsligt hamnade man utanför. Gambia överlag är inte särskilt bra på att hantera sopor och här märks det tydligt. Det luktar hemskt och stranden är skitig och nedskräpad. Vi åkte hem till hotellet ganska omgående. Här är nog ett måste att du har en guide med dig, vi hade vår Yakob som tog hand om oss hela veckan, han vallade runt oss.

title: Intensivt myller
text: Härlig marknad med intensivt myller. Här har jag shoppat barnkläder i afrikanska tyger, träsniderier, korgar mm. Här säljs även matvaror. Alla är på dig och vill visa sina varor och allt ska prutas.

title: Leuke ervaring,
text: afdingen geboden. Vriendelijke mensen, zelfs als je niets koopt. Een hemelsbreed verschil met noord-Afrika waar je aangeklampt en niet meer gelost wordt.

title: Grotere markt, veel kleding
text: Leuk om doorheen te wandelen, vooral stoffen en kruiden zijn leuk. Je wordt er niet heel erg lastig gevallen. Prima om zelf doorheen te wandelen, niet zo groot dat je verdwaalt.

title: Mooi hier
text: Zo gezellig om hier te lopen we rommelig maar dat hoor hier zo en de mensen zijn hier egt vriendelijk en niet opdringerig

title: Nice!
text: Well worth a visit! Don’t forget to negotiate the price when you’re there. Not very big, but a nice experience with opportunity for shopping.

title: A must-see spot
text:
