This is the main market in the city and is a hive of activity. There are shops on either side of the main street, but the market itself is off to one side and is a rabbit-warren of alleyways and stalls. You'll find just about everything on sale here but it is a great place to buy souvenirs. Some really good and colourful material on offer.

There are loads of sights and sounds. You'll probably find that young (and some not so young) men will offer to guide you around. It is probably worth accepting the offer of one of them, otherwise you'll find yourself pestered constantly and you simply won't be left alone to wander at your leisure. All they expect is a few Euros or dollars at the end of your visit.

Remember that bartering is near-mandatory here. A good gauge is to pay about one third of what the seller first asks for. Be persistent. If you start to walk away, your offer will generally be accepted. Even so, things are good value and, generally, good quality.

You cannot visit Banjul without coming here.

title: A revisit with a local and some serious shopping...
text: And she knew where to go, what she was looking for and what to pay.  Always of interest to me the colours the smells the bussle of activities. Got herbs and spices, house goods and bike bits lot cheaper that supermarket, cloth apparently better bought at Serrekunda, photos to follow.

title: It is a big market area...lots of walking around....
text: Yes...worth a visit for as short or as long as you wish.  Colourful and stimulating smeliferous.  Everything under the sun!  Much less hassle if you use a guide/escort for this part of a visit to Banjul.  Walk the fish market area and beach...including the to and fro for the local ferry boats.

title: Eye opening
text: A real insight into Africa. A must do experience for all the family. Not much to buy but great to see. Make sure you take a guide with you.

title: Good view
text: Went up arch 22 amazing views from above Banjul and the lovely beaches . We came down and had a lovely drink and a sand which with the locals and Billy's bar

title: Life of Banjul from up above....
text:
We went to The Gambia in October 2012, and Arch 22 was one of the 1st sites we came across. You can park right beside the arch which, offers great convenience. The arch itself is not in great condition, and if we remember right, the entrance fee was 50 dalasi per person.
A museum is located half way up the arch, which displays Gambian culture before their  independence from Great Britain. Once up on the balcony of the arch, you now have a great view of the city of Banjul. if you have been to the city of Banjul, then you will know that the place is nothing special. But the views overlooking the city are great. Different stories are being told at every angle of your view, so take advantage because you won't have a better opportunity! At least the president has given the tourists a positive side of Banjul....

title: Arch 22
text: nice view over the city. within the tower you find a neglected exposition of jujus and traditional living.

title: Great views
text:
You can't miss it when you enter Banjul.
The view from the top balconies is great. The arch is certainly impressive, although its design is a metter of taste I suppose.
You also wonder whether the money spent on this mightn't have had a better purpose...

title: historie
text: normaal kom je er niet snel maar wel leuk om te doen met locale gids yaya en dan combineren met een bezoek aan de markt

title: Total heruntergekommen
text: Dieses Objekt ist eine Schande. Das Cafe gibt es nicht mehr, die Fahrstühle sind kaputt, das Museum ist verdreckt und es gibt kein Licht in den engen Wendeltreppen. Aber es kostet noch Eintritt.

title: A monument to the President
text: An impressive structure that you can walk up to experience a view across the whole of Banjul. There's not much apart from the view ,but it does put things into perspective.... a multi million pound self commissioned tribute to a president that shows his people living in squalor.

title: Great Views
text: Well worth a visit and very close to the Laico Atlantic, would recommend climbing to the top as you get great views of Banjul, for those who don't want to climb the stairs there are lifts available, there is also an interesting museum. Entry is only £2 well worth it

title: up and away
text: Great view of Banjul - you can take a lift or stairs to the top then take photos of the city and beach

title: Worth a look
text: As great views of the city and has a very qwerkie museum at the top. It's a short walk from the Atlantic but take a guide in yellow/mustard tops with you and you won't get hassled

title: worth a visit
text:
A little run down, but the views are fantastic.
The museum / displays at the top are a bit of a waste of time, but it is a good experience.
A fantastic photo opportunity

title: worth a stop off and a climb to the viewing platform for the view
text: We climbed the stairs of the Banjul arch,there is a lift, and found there is a museum type of display to look around and viewing platforms where you get a lovely view all around Banjul of the mosques,the sea and creeks over the rooftops and you see many of the modern buildings that the President has had built,standing alongsides the locals humble buildings-this says it all !!! Theres is a cafe near the base of the arch in a green area offering pleasant refreshments where you can sit and watch everyday life going on around you.

title: A useful landmark at the edge of the town.
text: One of the tourist "sights" of Banjul but not very striking. From the top, there is a good view of the town just about making the effort of climbing worthwhile.

title: Congratulations mr. President
text: The lokation for all the celebracions and ceremonials. After  the revolution build when they became a "democracy"

title: Great Views of the capital.
text:
Short walk from the Atlantic Hotel, great views and interesting small exhibition.#You dont need a guide for this one.
Nice place in the gardens at the bottom of the arch for lunch or a drink.

title: Impressive
text: It was really nice to see the Arch in the night, as it was after the presidents election so the Arch was lit up through the night, making really a nice place to walk by.

title: Old decrepit monument
text: Not much too see - we didn't climb to the top though, as I am certain it would not have changed much. Overall just an arch falling in ruins, and mainly there to celebrate the peoples dubious love for their president!

title: Just a great view
text: This is one of the tallest buildings of Banjul. And it offers a fabulous view over the entire area. A must if you are nearby!

title: just an arch!?!
text: nil special other than, only the (current) president allowed to go through it,has small viewing upper level,view of ?

title: Not much to offer
text: The structure is okay it adds something to the city but they very tittle to offer

title: Manic, colourful and fun.
text: Exactly what you would expect from a West African market, busy, colourful, noisy.  Sadly couldn't find the shirt I wanted, but didn't have much time to explore.

title: handwerk op niveau
text: Heel leuk om de lokale bevolking aan het werk te zien. Vervelend is wel dat ze erg kunnen zeuren om aandacht. You are my best friend i give you best price is de meest gehoorde zin op de markt.

title: Meer van hetzelfde
text: Meer van hetzelfde. Dezelfde houten beeldjes, kettinkjes enz, Zeer drukke verkopers en uiteindelijk niet de moeite waard om te bezoeken. Spulletjes zijn gewoonweg te duur.

title: Najlepsze miejsce z pamiątkami
text: Wszystkie możliwe pamiątki kupicie właśnie tam. Szeroki wybór dzianin, wyrobów z drewna oraz magnesów na lodówkę. Te ostatnie są dość drogie w porównaniu z Europą - od 100 do 150 dalasi.

title: Drogo - w sklepach hotelowych wywoławczo połowę taniej...
text:
Ogólnie ciekawe miejsce, na którym jest mnóstwo rękodzieła oraz miejscowych ubrań - znajdziemy tam różnego rodzaju koraliki, czapki, drewniane maski i wiele wiele innych drobiazgów. Wadą miejsca jest bardzo duża "upierdliwość" sprzedających i bardzo wysokie na dzień dobry ceny... np. w sklepie hotelowym było około połowę taniej na start...
najlepszym sposobem na spokojne pooglądanie targowiska - było mówienie, iż nie zna się angielskiego...
Miejsce jest atrakcyjne dla osób chcących zobaczyć miejscowe rekodzieło.

title: Kameralnie :-)
text:
Polecam na zakup drobnych upominków .
Tylko pamiętaj o zasadzie targuj ile się da z uśmiechem na twarzy ;)

title: Craft market
text: They have a lot but they became hostile when we did not buy at there shop. It is not as nice as it use to be. Maybe better when you shop with a husband with you instead of just two women...

title: Good for gifts
text: Good for gifts, but don't buy straight away , tell them what you want to pay, walk off and they will come after you.

title: Very aggressive seller
text: Small market with lots of salesmen hunting  for the tourists. You can find the standard range of useless nick nacks. Prices are very high. The fruit seller women at the entrance are much more authentic Gambian and certainly worth a chat and spending a few dalasi for a banana or so.
My only advice is remember to haggle and don't buy first time as there are similar or same item at each stall x

title: ok for the new visitor
text: get all Gambian trinkets and stuff for presents but do haggle its a must but don't be pushed into buying what you don't want

title: leuke markt
text: aardig marktje, veelal dezelfde spullen, je kunt kleding op maat laten maken, besef dat ze teveel vragen en je moet onderhandelen

title: Better markets close by
text: I pass through this market often.  I find the people can be a bit aggressive on some visits.  I find the prices a bit higher than if I travel a bit farther to the Baku Market where I find I am not hassled as much with a larger selection of items.

title: An experience !!
text:
This  market was manic  amazing dirty unbelievable place they were selling chickens fruit Shea butter handbags clothes food aluminium cooking pots  and everything else you could think of ! People were pushing wheelbarrows full of stock in narrow walkways full of people ! The noise was incredible but all the people were smiling ! Women had babies on their backs or breastfeeding whilst selling the goods ! 
There were hundreds of stalls all the same I cannot believe they ever sold it all if anything !  But you have to go to believe it

title: Veel van hetzelfde
text: Zoals op zoveel handwerk marktje in Gambia zie ook hier veel van hetzelfde. Armbandjes, houtsnijwerk in verschillende kwaliteiten, stoffen en jurkjes. Maakt niet zoveel indruk.

title: Waste of time
text:
Can't really agree with the positive past reviews of this small overly priced market. 

Every vendor uses the same selling phrase...
"As I'm their first customer...I'll get a special price "!!!

The inflated prices are higher than hotel and other markets. 

Of course I bartered but the price still ended up higher than other places. And no...I am very good at this. I'm world travelled and yet their prices are not really negotiatable. 

Have a quick mooch but don't go past 1800. It shuts which is a shame as during the day there's no atmosphere. 

Would I go again.....?  No

Go to Serrekunda Market instead.

title: Wat een gastvrijheid
text: Leuke markt met hele aardige mensen. Veel handwerk. Willen uiteraard graag verkopen. Wie niet in Gambia. Jaw the Musickman maakt mooie spullen. Gezellig aanschuiven en praten met elkaar. Helemaal top.

title: Good experience but lots of hassel
text:
Enjoyed looking round, we did get hassled to buy everything though.  We did buy some drums which were excellent.

A nice experience just stay strong you can say no!

title: It is what it is .
text: As per tittle it is what it is ,, worth a look , you will be hassled but you will be anywhere like this in TG ,, but most of the stalls sell the same thing ,,but hey you are in Africa .

title: would sell more with less hassle
text:
love having a look around the market but tends to be a rush as you do get a lot of hassle to buy 
if store holders gave you time to look at your own pace they would sell a lot more

title: Local market
text: A large market selling food, clothing, house hold goods and live stock. It is a worth a visit to soak up the sights, sounds and smells. If you have a taxi here, your driver will probably show you around.

title: Targ afrykański
text: Każdy, kto będzie w Banżul powinien zobaczyć to miejsce. Można tu kupic dosłownie wszystko, od żywności po stroje czy też pamiątki. Atmosfera jest tu specyficzna i zapach też:) Jest bardzo, bardzo kolorowo.

title: Pala aitoa Afrikkaa
text: Oltiin Timo toursin retkellä Senegalin eläinpuistossa, käytiin tullessa piipahtamassa Albert marketissa. Ostettiin puuveistoksia niitä oli hyvät valikoimat, tinkiä kannattaa hinnasta 2/3 osaa ainakin pois. Kannattaa ainakin jotain ostaa, valikoimaa on tosi paljon. Käytävät ovat sokkeloisia ja melko ahtaita. Afrikan tuoksuja ja hajuja, tämä pitää kaikkien kokea jotka tänne asti tulevat.

title: Your typical African Market
text: Just your typical African Market.  Largest in Banjul but small when compared to some of the markets in my home country. Would be of great interest to Europeans. I was able to buy some local print shirts and dresses as souvenirs.

title: Albert Market
text: A local market in downtown Banjul.it is a daily crowded noisy busy market with cramped aisles like a maze.it sells everything & anything.not for the faint hearted. The main post office is on the same street.worth a visit to see activity.

title: Interesante pero un pocl hostil
text: No es que no esté acostumbrado a este tipo de concurridos mercados ni a la insiatencia acostumbrada de sus vendedores, pero no se si es por casualidad o si realmente es así, pero encontré un personal especialmente cáustico y impertinente. Pero aún así, el sitio está bien para verlo.

title: Para perderse
text: Un mercado de artesanías locales, con unos puestos geniales, donde el regateo es parte de la vida interna del Mercado. Ubicado en Pleno Banjul. Visita Obligada a quien va a Gambia.

title: INTERESTING
text: Albert Market is something to see. It is quite large and is very cramped. The aisles are extremely narrow. It is one of those market that purely shows you the way of life of the Gambian people. They sale old clothes, fish (mostly covered in flies), vegetables, nuts, household bits and pieces, cotton fabric and a bit of everything in between. You can even have some clothes made for you there as you will find some very talented dressmakers. This market will be a bit of a challenge for those who suffer crowds, noise and at time bad smell. Try to go in the afternoon as it is less crowed. If you find something that attract your fancy, don't forget to bargain... cut in half or more the price offered and get to a point that you are both happy with. Happy hunting.

title: digusting, full of flies, not worth visiting
text:
1. It was like any market in the world that had all the products there. The difference was that this one was truly disgusting. Fruits were rotting, there were thousands of flies everywhere. 

2. The people can be pretty annoying too. They hiss at you and try to call you in, but in a rude matter. 

3. No real places to eat and if you want to eat a proper meal, don't ever eat here. You might even get cholera if you are not careful. 

Seriously, don't waste your time and energy visiting, unless you have nothing to do and have time to kill.

title: Speciaal om te bezoeken maar...
text: De markt bezoeken is eigenlijk wel een must do als je er bent maar in het regen seizoen (nu dus)moet je de stink lucht en de gratis miljoenen vliegen en dat alles vies is wel op de koop toenemen. Maar om te bezoeken wel heel erg speciaal. Ben door het vele reizen best wel iets gewend maar dit is heftig hou er rekening mee.

title: Het echte Gambia
text: Deze markt is zeker een bezoek waard als je het echte Gambia wilt leren kennen, er is van alles te koop en de mensen zijn zeer vriendelijk

title: The 'Royal Albert' always worth a visit if in Banjul and an hour to spare.
text: Might be serious shopping for the initiated, fish, fruit and veg, fabrics or a browse around the many craft stalls at the back. Always a bargin to be had with a bit of negotiation and this time of year some real photo treats as the Gambians go about their daily routine, in colourful dress and close to Ramadam.

title: Handbag shopping
text: At the back of Albert market is the craft market is the craft area. We picked up a beautiful handbag and leather bracelet as well as a great piece of cloth all at the right price

title: a go to place to shop for just about anything
text: Albert Market, Banjul is indeed the go to place to buy anything, be it local art curios, local fabrics or readymade clothes, shoes and knic knacs. The advantage - you can find all of it in one place. The disadvantage - for people not comfortable with crowds, it can be a bit of an exercise. Vendors will call out, ask you what you want, show their wares. A lot of goods are cheap copies of famous brands but some shops also do keep originals if you have a keen eye. All in all a world in itself if you are unafraid to explore its winding by lanes. Happy Hunting!!

title: Bazar market
text: Wyglad Targ niczym w polsce tylko wiecej owocow egzotyk.super pokazane to na fotkach tego serwis duzo moZna sie dowiedziec.nim sie pojedzie zycie tam z tego co wiem od znajomy net z tad Tania jedynie dla turystow bedzie drogi lot.

title: IL MERCATO
text: Davvero autentico questo mercato nella piccola città di Banjul merita una visita per rendersi conto di come vivono gli abitanti del più piccolo stato dell'Africa

title: Beetje toeristisch maar wel goed en overzichtelijk
text: Fijne markt in de slaperigste hoofdstad van Afrika, lekker slenteren over de kleding en food market en handelen op de craft market

title: Lovely market with great people
text: Lovely market with fantastic people their was a lot to choose from the carvings were brilliant I did  uy a few but it was very hot when myself and my husband went the locals are very friendly the don't try and rip you of that's what I like I just name my price and this it but definitely worth a visit.

title: Leuke markt met aangrenzend winkelstraat
text:
De Albert market is een kleinere markt waar van alles te vinden is. Als je goed onderhandelt dan kun je goede prijzen krijgen. Ik kwam meestal uit op een derde of soms een kwart van de openingsprijs. Bij de kleinere dingen tot 100 dalassi (2€) deed ik geen moeite. De mensen spreken goed Engels. Ik heb daar een handgemaakte djembe gekocht (65 cm hoog en 35cm diameter) van ongeveer 9 kilo met een geweldige klank en inclusief tas.

Als je de markt uit komt heb je een 'nette' winkelstraat.
De markt van Serekunda is 3 keer groter, drukker en de prijzen zijn vergelijkbaar.

title: Visita tipica de la ciudad de Banjul
text: La capital, Banjul tiene "poco" que visitar, pero el mercado es uno de esos lugares donde la gente del lugar accede a realizar sus compras diarias y se puede observar las frutas, comidas... Lo mejor la zona de artesanía aunque un poco escasa comparada con el mercado de Brikama

userLocation.name: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain

title: Ni siquiera lo he visitado.
text: No iba a Gambia a ver "monumentos", aunque, ahora que lo pienso, lo VÏ!!! y pasé por debajo!!. Una birria.

title: Neglected building but great view
text:
We took the short walk from our hotel and paid the fixed entrance price of 50 Dalasi. Inside the building is sadly neglected and poorly maintained but for the view alone it is certainly worth a visit. The lift may not function very well as we were encouraged to take the stairs and told by the attendant that 'excercise is good in the morning'! The spiral stairs are manageable and should not cause any concern for those of any age or ability. 

The exhibits are interesting and fill you in on the ancient tradition of 'Juju' culture in Gambia. Juju refers to the use of objects and other things to perform a form of witchcraft and a range of such objects are available to look at and learn about. These are a little dusty and poorly maintained but provide a fascinating insight into Juju culture in the Gambia. 

The view from the very top of the structure is best and worth continuing to the top for.

title: Cheap way to see Banjul from above
text: The actual building is now rather tatty, and there are a few interesting exhibits in the arch, but it's worth the small fee to see the views.

title: very pretty
text: the view is good and nicely light up at night till 10

title: Best view of Banjul available
text: Go with a Government guide and pay just D 50 - walking up is easy although one part was dark where a light bulb had not been replaced.

title: rien à visiter
text:
je suis en Gambie depuis 3 mois et je dois vous dire et veuillez m'excusez peuple gambien, mais votre pays n'a rien d’intéressant à donner au visiteur...
i y a aucune trace du passer je parle des monument bien attendu, pas de musée, bref rien... la culture africaine n'est quasiment inexistants c'est d'un ennuie à mourir...
le point positive de tout de même, c'est les plages son très préserves contrairement au senegal où elles sont salent et abîmées par les constructions anarchiques. la nature est aussi bien préservé... mais à part rien à voir circuler... dommage!!

title: One of the few places to visit in Banjul city
text:
We were told at the entrance that the price for taking the stairs or the lift is the same. Infact, the person at the front encouraged us to take the 'safer' stairs.

The place has a wondeful history of some of the traditions of Gambian tribes called juju. Also you get a good view of Banjul, not that there is much to see.

title: like a big christmas tree!
text: looked amazing at night all lit up in the gambian flag!

title: It's ok
text: We visited Banjul and arch 22 was the best part of it the city itself is grimy dusty and other than the fish Market didn't find it that interesting good views from arch 22 it's worth a look but that's all.

title: A bit shaky!
text: Banjul itself is a dirty, dusty place with little to see. The Arch is fairly ugly but the view from the top does give a good vantage point over the city. Apparently it's not too stable so it may not be standing in the future!

title: amazing views
text: Fabulous views of the island of gambia, very interesting history lesson too.

title: Lo único
text:
Realmente, es el unico monumento de la ciudad.
Merece bastante más la pena visitar Albert Market y despúes desplazarse al interior para conocer la Gambia rural.
Creo que no merece la pena pagar por entrar.

title: Curioso
text: Una de las pocas atracciones que tiene Banjul. No subimos porque no nos pareció muy atractivo.  Resulta raro que solo lo pueda por  cruzar los coche militares o de policía, pero los coches que salen de la ciudad o van a entrar tienen que sortearlo, y en uno de los dos laterales no esta ni asfaltado, pasas del asfalto al Paris-Dakar. Sorprendente.

title: A good viewpoint for Banjul
text:
The Arch 22 is a good point to get an overview of the capital. The Arch itself and the exhibition on the top level are not really spectacular. You can - and I recomment to do so - take a lift up to the top level.
It was built in 1996 to mark the military coup on 22 July 1994.
The arch stands on the Banjul-Serrekunda highway. A statue of the unknown soldier can be seen near the base of the arch.

title: Arch22
text: It is not quite what it seems..It was built to celebrate the military takeover of the current president... there are two lifts, but only one works and you have to pay a fee. No one says you can walk up the arch for free until you get back down.  Up top it was disappointing.. the view was OK for long distance camera shots....but the top floor was a poorly equipped musuem and and a small tacky shop. The first floor was supposed to be a resturant at some time in the past , but was now shut.

title: Amazing if you're a Birder
text: Easy to get to by Taxi from Banjul.  Good number of Gambian Bird Species and mammals.  Well run with guides available.  Early morning or late afternoon visits are essential to have the best birding experience.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: A vast improvement at Abouko.
text:
New look Abouko. 
03 November 2014, 15:29
Lovely to see Abouko Park has been taken over by some responsible people,now renamed Eagle Heights,it puts on flying displays each morning,various new animals are presant including Leopards and baby lions and various raptors,its being well run and the animals are being well cared for,theres a new refreshments area and a nice shady lodge where you can now view the various activities,most important the various indigenous animal species will,overtime,be introduced back into the park,details are on FB.

03 November 2014, 15:34
Eagle Heights Gambia is NOW OPEN! 

Eagle Heights Gambia is based at the beautiful Abuko Nature Reserve in The Gambia, West Africa. Set among almost 500 acres you will be entranced by the flora and fauna around you. 

Currently at the Centre are our 2 Cheetah with which we are hoping to begin a successful breeding project. A selection of Birds of Prey including a Crowned Eagle, Lanner Falcon, Tawny Eagle and Bateleur Eagle! 

The current orphanage inside Abuko will be collaborating with us enabling us to move the Hyena from their current enclosure to a new and improved version. This also applies to the Baboons and any other animals that arrive at the orphanage from now on. 

Daily Talks will take place along with a flying demonstration. You will also be invited to take a pit stop at our Bar for an all important refreshment!

Following the opening of the centre we will then begin our second project, Reintroduction! We will be reintroducing many once indigenous species back into the Abuko Buffer Zone. These are species that once lived there naturally but were unfortunately wiped out by humans etc.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Superb!
text: Set In a dry rainforest there is much to see here, many birds of which there are too many to name an in terms of mammals if you arrive early and go to the hide that looks over the small lake you have a high chance of seeing vervet monkey, red colobus monkey, bushbuck, sun squirrel and if lucky sitatunga! There are also a pair of resident nile crocodiles that inhabit the lake.. You can see many of the kingfisher species here aswell as palm nut vulture, violet turaco, hammerkop and a few hornbill species! Small fee to get in but if you have a good guide the cost of your guide normally means they pay for you! At the end of the trail at Abuko there is a woodland bar where you can get close to the vervet monkeys but don't get too close as a scratch or bite could lead to worse! By the bar is an animal orphanage of injured wild animals in recovery including baboons, Patas monkey and spotted hyena

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Great Birding Venue
text: Anyone visiting here should be well aware of its birding heritage, what I would say is hire a good reputable guide. I have visited twice although the first visit yielded a good array of birdlife the second visit was much more productive mainly down to the guide.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Not much to see
text:
We went to this park with taxi and spent there maybe 2-3 hours. We had a guide and it was useless. There weren't many animals or much to see. Day was really hot in February (47 celcius )
There are better places to go in Gambia so i don't recommend this place :)

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Poco Interesante
text:
Visité este parque en Junio y nada interesante. Vimos unos cuantos monos en libertad pero el resto de animales estaban enjaulados. Según nos acercamos a esa zona, había un pequeño caimán en una de ellas, se volvió medio loco y en tres golpes rompió la malla y se escapó dirección al bosque,esa pequeña anecdota fué lo más interesante de nuestra visita. 
También decir que en varios sitios turisticos a los que fuimos a la hora de pagar, tienden a no tener dinero para darte las vueltas.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Very interesting
text: We went at the wrong time of the day (11.00am) so we were still walking through Reserve at midday and beyond (takes about 2 hours).  It was very hot but we survived and enjoyed the experience very much.  If you don't like the heat (or monkeys jumping out of the bushes at you!) don't got at the height of the day.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Nature reserve
text:
We went here as part of our group bird watching tour, out guide was very good and we was able to see a lot of different birds, we did other animals as well including monkeys.
We didn't really like the conditions the hyenas were kept in the cages seemed small and they were quite dirty.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: nur wald und katastrophaler Guide
text: beim eingang wurde uns ein preis gennant der jeden zoo in europa günstig aussehen lässt, mithilfe unseres gambianschen freundes den preis heruntergedrückt. der guide musste serparat gebucht werden, okay er lief voraus und wir hinten nach, das tempo war atemberaubend, die kinder mussten wir bald tragen.. nach gut einer halben stunde sagte er uns, achtung kinder nicht tragen wegen den grünen mambas.. hallo geht das eine halbe stunde bis er es merkt?  am schluss wurde ein kind noch von einem affen angefallen...

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: nada interesante, animales en malos condiciones
text:
gran decepción, un par de monos, la mitad de ellos cerrados en jaulas, un mono cerrado en una jaula muy pequeña, te daba una pena, hienas tampoco no estaban en buenas condiciones, 
parque no esta preparado para los turistas, un bar estaba cerrado, solo uno abierto donde podrias comprar una Coca-Cola, nada mas, monos libres que aparecen allí y que puedes dar cacahutetes están también en otros sitios. bueno, no recomiendo, para gente que les gusta los animales, porque sales de allí triste. no puedo decir que mueren de hambre, pero condiciones son malos.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: mooi maar vrij klein natuurpark
text: Het Abuko Nature reserve is een mooi natuurpark, maar verwacht hier niet een weeld eaan dieren zoals in de parken in Oost- en Zuid-Afrika. Wel veel vogels en apen, maar geen grote zoogdieren.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Видели крокодила
text: Мне парк очень понравился. На кассе пытаються втюрить экскурсовода, от услуг которых мы вежливо отказались, так как хотели погулять вдвоем. Билет стоит в районе 40 далласи. Мы с собой зяли нашего таксиста, чтобы он не скучал в машине, Для местных вход еще дешевле, около 15 далласи. В парке мы видели крокодила, много разных обезьян, интересные деревье. Я рекомендую, идти в парк с самого утра, так как можно встретить большее количество животных, которые после обеда прячутся. Цены на напитки в парке умеренные, можно купить арахис и бананы, чтобы покормить обезьян, но лучше взять это с собой.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Mucho mejor que Bijilo
text: El único sitio dónde contratamos un guía, la visita merece la pena, vimos cocodrilos, antílopes, muchos monos, ardillas, buitres y demás aves. Además tienen hienas, eso si, enjauladas, según nos contaron se trata de un proyecto de rehabilitación de estos animales, la verdad es que fue impresionante verlas en acción, llegamos justo cuando las alimentaban y estaban como locas riéndose y dando vueltas.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Great park, I enjoyed the trip
text: Lot of serious birders wandering around with massive cameras, the best place to see all sorts of birds, there is a small lake that attracts all sorts of birds and a few hides scattered around. They have Hyenas who are to fat to even chase the vultures away from pinching their food, never seen such fat animals. Also caged  baboons. The keeper told me most of these animals have been rescued from bad homes. I was concerned about a very skinny Baboon but I was told he was taken from a soldier who was not looking after him. They certainly do their best to look after the animals. Refreshments in the centre of the park with some seats in the shade, that was nice. I enjoyed the day, would recommend a visit

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: I expected more
text:
For such a big space i was expecting to see more animals. Our guide was great and very informative but the lack of animals was disappointing and i'm sure we walked a couple of hours. Apart from the two types of monkey that were roaming about (one type was the same as the ones that come to the hotel) the others were caged, the hyenas were just lying about because of the heat, the crocodiles were nowhere to be seen, and i saw one exotic looking bird (apart from the caged parrot)!
They said they were getting more animals in soon but it wasn't a very exciting walk unfortunately, but to be fair its not their fault that the animals were hiding, not around and tired.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Abouko......Disgraceful
text: This must be one of the most neglected parks I've ever seen,its got worse over the past 3 years . The caged animals are in a pityfull state. The baboon troop has dwindled from 40 animals to a handful,there kept in a bare cage,in another sparse cage was a vulture with a live monkey for company it was obviously the birds food! In the same cage last year was a giant tortoise and a pelcan,no sign of those and seeing the conditions they living in I fear the worse . The Hyenas were in a awful state ,one was surounded by vultures and it was obvious he was sick. Stay away if you are an animal lover or you will leave this hell hole  in tears.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Birders paradise;think again
text: This park like all the other parks we visited has been seriously neglected despite staff who sit about all day doing nothing. It is in need of signs; the lavatories need cleaning up and  like all parks geared for birdwatching it needs the provision of water so that birds can be observed.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Not much to see. Guides useless
text:
Went to Abuko Nature Reserve with good intentions, and was met by a guide that wanted 400 D for a tour (ended up with 300 D) and gave the impression it was manditory with a guide (it is not). He talked a little about the history of the park and the trees. Walked around paths with trees, bushes, a few birds, monkees and butterflies. Ended up at the orphanage with monkees and hyenas in cages.
Dissapointing experience.
If you go don´t take a guide.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Maybe need to go early in the morning?
text: There are mixed reviews for this park. We went late morning and were disappointed: little to see, some caged hyenas, self appointed guide, aggressive monkeys (not like Bijolo). Maybe the higher ratings are for early morning when there is more bird life? We saw four birds only. It takes two hours to walk around the one forest path.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Nothing to see
text:
Well, we really did not see anything else than the caged animals (poor hyenas, one was in a really small cage, baboons and turtles).

In the beginning the quide (who invited himself with us) told that we probably aint gonna see any animals.. cause they are sleeping or eating or what ever. And we really did not see anything, not even birds. We walked an hour in the "jungle". There was a "crocodile pool" where was supposed to be 50 or something crocodiles, didnt see any, and nobody else has seen.

Welt kind of like cheated, had to pay for the quide too. Felt bad cause of the caged animals. Aint gonna visit Abuko never again.

placeInfo.name: Abuko Nature Reserve
placeInfo.address: 15 Miles South of Banjul Kombo North District, Banjul Gambia

title: Klimat dawnej Afryki
text:
Miejsce jest bardzo specyficzne. Kolorowe, tętniące życiem, duszne i śmierdzące jednocześnie. Przypomina mi nasz stadion X lecia w wydaniu lokalnym. Turyści są tam mile widziani pod warunkiem, że coś kupują. Łatwo tam znaleźć coś dla siebie. Ja kupiłem suszone kwiaty hibiskusa na herbatę, pyszne owoce baobabu i jeszcze jakieś super nawilżające masło shea. Inni brali koszulki, pareo, wyroby z drewna. Z całą pewnością warte odwiedzenia bez względu jak je ocenicie. 
Sprzedawcy nieco nachalni za to z podstawami polskiego.

title: Intensivt och komprimerat Gambia
text: Färger, dofter, människor från många olika miljöer och sociala förhållanden samlas på denna marknad. En till plats man inte ska missa!

title: Kaikkea !
text: Täältä löytyy kaikenlaisia käsitöitä. Sokkeloinen markkinapaikka täynnä iloisia myyjiä. Tinkiminen on osa kaupantekoa. Hinnasta pois 80% ainakin!

title: Real local market
text:
A peek into a real local experience of a market. Knowing that you won't be getting your groceries there, the people at the market don't hassle you but go about their way as usual. You can sit and have a drink at the end, and of course there's stalls where you can buy souvenirs.

I wouldn't venture in here alone, so coming with a guide would probably be best.

title: Excursietripje met gids vanaf Kololi's Senegambiabeach hotel
text: Geweldige ervaring om op deze "overdekte"markt met zoveel vriendelijke mensen met vele soorten koopwaar in winkel rijke omgeving

title: Market
text: Very interesting but very smelly and a lot of flies wouldn't go there on your own as quite scary don't think I would buy food, we went more for fabrics and gifts, and only pay 1/3 what they ask for.

title: Amazing place
text: Very interesting to see but very very busy , the shop owners are very pushy which can be a bit to much at times. Very interesting to see items being made although the fish can be very smelly and full of flies.  Amazing to see all the items on sale and a real look at gambian people and there life.

title: Bustling African market selling everything
text: This is the oldest & largest market in Banjul.  Here you can buy everything from food to household goods, and also local crafts.  Although Gambia is fairly safe, watch your purse or wallet.  Haggling is a must.  The craft shops will be very persistent but simply ask them to give you room and time to decide.  Many people do not want their photos taken so you need to ask first or be quick.

title: Banjul Market
text: Geweldige ervaring op de Banjul Market. Veel verschillende producten, veel kleuren, goedkoop en goede producten varierend van Afrikaanse kleding, sieraden, groenten, houtsnijwerk tot haarproducten. Wie kan onderhandelen over de prijs is hier op zijn plaats, anders een gids meenemen

title: אחלה מקום לקניות לכול המשפחה
text: מקום נהדר לקנו. הכל... בגדים לכולם להורים לאחים לילדים ולעצמנו בעיקר... בנוסף תכשיטים שעונים פרחים שעושים יפה בעין.... לאיקר יחסית לקניונים בסביבה ממש קונים הכל באווירה נעימה ובמחירים סבירים ונהנייים... מוממלץ

title: Gambia en general, nos encantó
text: Lugar increíble, sus gentes fenomenales, ningún tipo de queja. Hicimos muchas excursiones con un guía y un 4X4,  nos lo pasamos pipa. Tienen unas playas fenomenales. Los mercados son brutales.

title: watch out for the bumsters
text:
We tried to visit the market at our own, but Always hassled by different locals who wanted to be our guide, who knows the things always better and who are only intreseted in the tip.
The food market is different, don't mind the thousands of flies and the odeur.
Prices are rather high.

title: Albert market
text: Awful scary place. Full of bad smells and desperate people trying to make a living 😦😱😱👃We did buy a beautiful mask and met a holy man . Not somewhere I would return unlike Gambia itself. We have returned since Albert Market and enjoy other parts of Gambia

title: Gambian shopping Center
text: If you are curious about a classical african market you may have a short look because of bad smelling. You can buy some simple sovanuir for friends.

title: Afrika på en timme!
text: Här blandas alla dofter, och färger i ett enormt skådespel. Kvinnorna gör sina dagliga inköp av färsk fisk och grönsaker.

title: Ambiance assurée
text: La plupart des Gambiens ne possédant pas de frigo, ils font leurs courses chaque jour au marché. Faites y un tour et plongez dans une atmosphère authentique, faites de couleurs et de senteurs....

title: Härlig marknad
text: Väldigt stort, väldigt mycket att handla, väldigt billigt, pruta pruta pruta :) Vi åkte dit med lokal guide och kände oss väldigt trygga. Människorna är så trevliga och det är lätt att trivas. Absolut värt att åka dit! Man behöver mycket tid eftersom det är så stort

title: Chaotic but a very interesting experience
text: The smells (mostly pleasant) and the chaos makes this market an experience I shall never forget, but would definitely recommend as you need to be there to take it all in. You walk over rough ground through narrow channels between the traders and their stalls. They all call out to you to come and look at their wares and will almost plead with you to buy something and immediately start dropping the price even if you tell them you aren't buying, only looking. You have to be firm and walk away. I found it quite annoying because I really wanted to take my time and brouse properly. I might have actually spent more if I hadn't felt quite so hassled, but it's just a totally different culture. We had a guide with us who stepped in when he could tell we'd had enough of the hard-sell. I don't think I would have liked to go it alone! Not sure I'd want to go back either, which is a shame, but it's just not for me. As I said at the beginning though, don't be put off - go experience for yourself!

title: African market with all the noise and hassle
text: A very large market where you can find just about anythings from vegetables, jewellery, shoes to chickens and fish. Its easy to get lsot so dont turn away a self-invited guide, who will tell you he doesnt want money but at the end of the "tour" will complain you dint give him enough.

title: Surprised with this market wonderful place
text: Nice to mix with the locals who are all very friendly and polite. Varied market from carvings to general shopping and not expensive. Pleasant to just walk and grouse through the stalls and not being pushed into buying. Very memorable experience a must to visit

title: Kort bezoekje waard
text: Aardig, maar niet bijzonder. Je moet Gambia een beetje kennen om te weten hoe je met de mensen om moet gaan.

title: Cultural experience!
text: Nice little market for proper Gambian souvenirs.  All the stalls are mainly the same and sell the same things, carvings, jewellery, fabrics and bags.  The sellers will try and get you into their shop and force you to buy their goods.  If you don't want it, just a polite 'no thank you' and move on.  There is no fixed price on anything so they will ask you for your best price.  If you ask them to give you a price, barter down until you are satisfied.  I bought a nice wooden carving there where the guy told me 850 dalasis.  I ended up paying 300!

title: Good to have look at least two or three times.
text: You may find there a lot of wooden hand made masterpieces. If you like some thing but you are still not fully convinces you may ask to refresh colours before buying. The wooden masterpieces are really good but sometimes they lack of colours. Sandpaper or paint to wood would be of great use as a present. I bought on stall 77 from charming and very gifted guy huge chess (50 x 50 cm) with terrific big figures (11-17 cm).

title: More Relaxed than Serekunda
text:
A good collection of stalls selling jewellery, wood carvings, batik, accessories etc. Most of the stalls sell similar things to each other but lovely items nonetheless. The locals will hustle for business but in a milder manner than the stalls in Serekunda. It is not so hectic so you have more time to browse and consider. I wish more tourists visited the market as the locals there really need your business - many of them perhaps only selling one item a day,

My favourite stall was Roy's which is located towards the back (so make sure you don't leave him out or spend all your money too early!) He had a wonderfully carved giant crocodile that had taken him over 2 months to make. I would have loved to have purchased it but my budget would not have given him the fair price he deserved. He was also a very lovely man and advertises his stall as being 'hassle free' and that's exactly what it was.

title: A walk through the life of a Gambian Craftsman
text:
I wouldn't necessarily say that this market is any cheaper than anywhere else ,nor would I recommend it for those of you who don't like a 'hand's on approach' to business... But if you are curious, I urge you to speak to some of these traders to find out the story behind it all. 

For example, one individual, real name yusupha who calls his stall at the very back of the market 'Roye's' had carved a lifesize crocodile out of wood, it had taken him 3 months to intricately carve all the amazing detail and yet was prepared to start bartering at the equivalent of £25 for it (picture attached)

Some reviews call some of these people's products tat or knock offs from serrekunda market. Please reflect on your ignorance for one moment.

A lot of these people know anything else than the artistry of these crafts, they may be illiterate in some cases but can create amazing things. So spending an hour or so down this fascinating part of the otherwise westernised senegambia strip will truly open your eyes.

 There are some brilliant unique items to buy, which unlike the shops on the strip, go directly to the traders, who deserve it for their tireless effort. 

They will be insistent, they will beg you to buy, but they appreciate your interest in their artisan trade equally. I do warn you though, that you probably won't leave empty handed, but for a fair price for everyone.

title: looking for an experience
text: Take a leisurely walk around the craft market which has fantastic local carvings & jewellry. You can have fun haggling with the locals.Try the local street food

title: Craftmarkt links op de strip
text:
Hele kleurrijke markt veel handwerk word hier gemaakt
Mensen zijn wel ietwat opdringerig ze willen graag iets aan je verkopen, wel afdingen

title: Gaat wel
text: Veel toeristische spullen, leuker om op serekunda markt te gaan kijken. Leuk om te zien en leuk om af te dingen.

title: Lots to see
text: Lots of interesting little bits to buy, you have to barter very hard and can be a little intimidating if you don't be firm. The products are usually good with lots of carvings, art and local jewellery etc, also good for little shoe repairs if needed.

title: Mostly for tourists
text: Good assortment of tourist souvenirs.Clean, close to restaurants and charter hotels. For the real thing,go to Serekunda market for 8 Dalasi in a white minivans and be prepared for a contrast....

title: Zeker bezoeken
text: De moeite waard om door te lopen. Vele kleine winkeltjes die van alles aanbieden. Een aanrader om de plaatselijke sfeer op te snuiven.

title: Niet aan ons besteed
text:
Op deze locatie - aan de strip - kun je niet verwachten dat alles authentiek is, maar dit is wel erg gericht op toeristen. We vonden de sfeer niet echt super. Wellicht omdat we één van de weinige bezoekers waren.

Overal waar je maar even stil staat wil men je iets verkopen. Als je zegt dat je alleen maar kijkt en nog niet weet wat je wilt, zeggen ze iets in de trant van "vriendelijkheid kost niets".

Wij hebben er uiteindelijk niets gekocht. We zijn sowieso meer van de herinneringen en de foto's. Maar in dit geval vonden we de producten ook niet echt iets voor ons, al is dat natuurlijk persoonlijk.

title: Moet je eens bezoeken
text: Vele kleine winkeltjes die van alles aanbieden voor de toeristen, gemoedelijke sfeer wanneer je om kan gaan met de afrikaanse gewoonten. Zijn er koopjes te doen, hangt ervan af wat je zoekt en er wilt voor geven.

title: Not bad but not great
text: Theres a lot of hassle, but thats what you can expect from anywhere here. Most of the stalls have the exact same things but there are a couple of very nice ones selling a few nicer pieces at the far end of the market. For a more authentic experience, go to the Serrekunda craft market.

title: Zeker het bezoeken waard
text: Aan het begin van de strip ligt deze craftmarket. Niet bijzonder, want er zijn veel van dit soort marktjes in Gambia, maar vanuit ons hotel liepen we er zo heen. Het vormt een soort gemeenschap, want als je iets bij 1 stalletje niet vindt, dan haalt de verkoper het gewoon bij een ander stalletje vandaan. Het houtsnijwerk is in het algemeen niet van hoge kwaliteit qua afwerking. Er zit links achterin wel een goede houtsnijder. Op bestelling is alles te maken. Afdingen is net zoals overals in Gambia een spel dat gespeeld moet worden.

title: Hustle and bustle but mostly just hassle
text:
Overall

Lots to see, a small market and somewhere you could spend everyday browsing. The merchandise is mostly wood carvings, key rings, material bags and general touristic souvenirs. 

However it is such a shame because it's just not worthwhile rooting around given the amount of hassle you get to enter the stalls and buy something.

Vendors favourite words "come inside it does not cost anything to look and then you go" fat chance! You will be harassed to go in and harassed until you buy something!

They are very friendly people, the Gambians. However they have not realised that they are likely to sell more if they back off a little and let tourists browse.

Worth a visit to see the market but we have been here for four days and still have not mustered the courage to return.

title: Leuke kleine markt aan het begin van de strip
text: De Senegambia Craft Market is een kleine maar gezellige markt aan het begin van de strip waar ze houtsnijwerk, textiel, sieraden en heel veel souvenirs verkopen. Alleen maar kijken is haast onmogelijk, iedereen zal proberen je wat te verkopen. Vriendelijk aangeven dat je alleen maar wilt kijken, doet wonderen. Afdingen is ook op deze markt een must!

title: Geweldige ervaring
text: Erg leuk als je gewoon de tijd neemt om met de mensen te praten en even naar hun handel te kijken ze waarderen het als je de tijd voor ze neemt en zullen het je dan zeker niet kwalijk nemen als niets koopt

title: Hmm . . it all rather looked the same
text: Near the top of the strip, the craft market seems to be stocked with imported goods than locally crafted ones, and most of the stalls looked very similar.  There were some batik stalls which broke up the monopoly of the bangles, beads and baubles most of the other stalls had

title: leuk, maar commercieel
text: Het is een leuke markt, de spullen worden ook daadwerkelijk daar gemaakt, maar je wordt erg lastig gevallen om ook daadwerkelijk wat te kopen.

title: 6 in 1 Trip
text: One of our excursions, and part of the 6 in 1. Very good especially stroking the crocodiles with a walk around the park.

title: Krokodillenpool
text: Wij hebben het bezocht met een plaatselijke gids. Bijzonder om zo tussen de krokodillen te lopen. De wandeling er naar toe heeft vooral veel  indruk op mij gemaakt. Zie je een stukje van het echte leven in Gambia.  Terug gelopen over de plaatselijke markt. Bizar

title: Not big but nice!
text:
We went there and it was just a short trip from sun beach hotel just 20 min. walk trough bakau.
They have a albino crocodile there Charlie which is portriad in the watermark on the money. If you're lucky you can see him but he's in the water a lot

title: Krokotiili lammikko
text: Pääsi taputtelemaan krokotiileja jotka jäähdyttelivät varjossa tai auringossa kidat auki. Vaikka vaikuttavia petoja tuntui kuin ne olisi huumattu, mutta hoitajien mukaan ei. Vaikea löytää ilman paikallista taksia

title: Uitstapje krokodillen
text: Mooi om te zien hoe deze dieren beschermd worden in een rustgevende omgeving en er goed voor hen gezorgd wordt!

title: Cute little place
text: Little museum on the way in then time to get close to the crocs, a guide will talk you through the history and take pics for you, try to take pens, books etc for the local kids as they are all there when you come out (there's a little shop if you aren't prepared)

title: Leuk om heen te gaan
text: Leuk om te kijken ,maar het is niet zo groot, je loopt 1 rondje en dan ben je er weer uit ,maar wel veel info bij het begin over het land

title: Leuk om te ervaren
text: Leuk om eens mee te maken, lopen tussen de krokodillen, 1 krokodil mocht je aan raken, gids was vriendelijk en legde van alles goed uit,

title: Krokodillen aaien
text:
De krokodillen poel is leuk om te bezoeken, wel klein maar leuk.
Het museum geeft uitleg over het land zelf, is dus interessant. Dan korte wandeling tot bij de krokodillen waar er enkele van kunnen aangeraakt worden.

title: Quite different!
text: A good local trip and interesting museum that explains a great deal of the Gambian History. The crocs were very "crocy"

title: Leuk om te bezoeken
text:
Als je naar de krokodillenpool gaat kun je gelijk een bezoek brengen aan het museum van Bakau. Museum is niet groot maar wel erg leuk om even te kijken. We waren er met gids die veel vertelde over de geschiedenis. 

De krokodillenpool is leuk om te bezoeken. Grote vijver met 100 krokodillen waarvan enkele exemplaren aangeraakt kunnen worden. Het heilige water brengt voorspoed en zorgt voor vruchtbaarheid bij ongewenst kinderloze echtparen (zo is het verhaal). 

Gewoon een leuk uitje.
Toegangsprijs is 100 Dalasi dus daarvoor hoef je het niet te laten.

title: Lite obehagligt
text: Först ett museum med bl a traditionella dräkter som används vid festen i samband med den kvinnliga omskärelsen. Sedan ett gäng stora lösa krokodiler som de ville att vi skulle klappa och köpa mat till. Jag är mest glad att vi inte blev uppätna själva!

title: Lagom läskigt
text:
Trevlig liten oas med lagom spänningsfaktor. Vi hade egen guide med oss, men parkens egna var också väldigt trevlig.
Litet museum i anslutning till entrén om Gambias olika stammar. Förvånansvärt fräscha toaletter.

title: Värt ett besök
text:
Vi började med ett besök på ett litet museum som handlade om Gambias historia. Vi var där med en lokal kille ”guide”, vilket är det bästa att göra tycker vi. Sedan klappade ”gubben” på en av krokodilerna. Det var en ”krokodilguide” på plats, så det var inte så att man kunde springa runt och klappa hur som helst. Själv höll jag mig lite på avstånd. Respekt! Krokodilerna matas varje dag och det går åt 250 kg fisk dagligen. De matas inte med kött. Detta skall göra krokodilerna mätta och det är därför de är dåsiga och inte attackerar folk. Dock såg vi en som verkade aggressiv, men den gillade inte att bli störd. 
Området är inte stort, men det ska finnas ca 80 stycken där.

title: You get really close to crocodiles
text: This place is great!  You can actulally pet one of the crocodiles.  The history of how the pool was established was interesting.  Worth a visit!

title: A place to get close to crocodiles
text: Quite an experience!  Not for those scared of crocodiles.  The pool is full and you can watch them moving about and climbing out of the water and walking near you.  The staff are friendly and give advice on how to approach the crocodiles and touch them.  Have been several times and the place always fascinates.  The museum is interesting but tired.

title: Versteckt im Dorf - OK für 15 Minuten Stippvisite
text: Der Park ist im Grunde ein Teich mit Krokodilen, die weil stark gefüttert im Prinzip nur umher liegen. Man kann als Highlight die Krokodile streicheln, was aber auch nicht allzu umwerfend ist. Kann man machen, um das Häkchen zu setzen.

title: Super miejsce
text:
Polecam zdecydowanie, cena to 100 dalasi. 
Można dotknąć krokodyle. I zobaczyc nie wielkie muzeum. 
Fajna sprawa !

title: Halvtama krokodiler.
text: Efter man betalat inträdet tar guiden med besökaren till museet till höger innanför ingången. Det finns en stig som leder runt inom området och där får man känslan att man befinner sig i en djungel ! Bra guider !

title: Très touristique.
text: Excitant de se rapprocher des crocodiles. Voyage pas cher. L'étang n'est pas propre et il y a trop de crocodiles dedans. Très touristique.

title: Ett måste
text:
Ett måste att besöka denna marknad. Men var beredd på att de vill sälja ! !
Påstridiga men charmen på marknaden överväger allt. Ett måste dock! 
Pruta, Pruta, Pruta

title: Albert Market w Banjul
text: Albert Market w Banjul, to pełen życia , kolorowy, afrykański targ. Handel trwa tu praktycznie przez cały czas, ciągle pojawiają się świeże produkty : owoce, ryby, skóry, meble , artykuły codziennego użytku. Tutaj można kupić turystyczne pamiątki jak również kartki pocztowe wraz ze znaczkami oraz wymienić pieniądze.

title: Tam możesz kupić piękne orginalne rękodzieło :-)
text:
Odpowiednie miejsce jeżeli szukasz niesztampowej pamiątki z Afryki.
Są tam trzy stoiska z prawdziwymi perełkami .
Piękne maski używane w obrzędach oraz okiennice i figurki
Polecam spróbować również Cat Fish wędzonej palce lizać

title: The Real Gambia
text:
Visited as part of a 4 in 1-day tour with The Gambia Experience. 
This daily market is a fabulously chaotic mix of colours, smells and movement with people going about their daily lives in a maze of narrow lanes. With so many traders it’s amazing that most people manage to scrape a living!
Bartering is the name of the game. Tourist can expect to end up paying what is the starting price for the locals!
A great experience and well worth a visit.
TOP TIP
Be courteous, always ask if you can take photograph of traders and their stalls. These are dignified people, not theme park extras.

title: Worth a look
text:
Worth a look, but not overly impressed. The prices are much more than the local markets you find and a lot of the items are not as well finished. However it is a good experience and as always you will meet a lot of friendly locals! I would recommend taking a guide/driver in with you to stop most of the hassle you get. 
Good fun and interesting to see how other cultures live and shop! 
The hustle and bustle of Gambian lifestyle!

title: Traditonal and colourful market
text: This is a traditional and hassle free market where you cab see how Gambia people shop, the produce available and experience the colour and bustle of real daily life in the area. There is a small craft market but the general humdrum and vibrancy of the market is the real attraction

title: Banjul's most interesting offering
text: We took a taxi from our Kotu hotel and, on arrival, our driver unexpectedly got out of the car to come with us - so glad as we got to see things we'd otherwise have missed - in particular the areas where the fish catch is brought in and, next to it, where the fish is smoked. We were also able to browse at our leisure without any of the usual requests to look in every stall. We've been lucky to see many similar markets around the world and always find it very interesting (once we've put aside our squeamishness!!) to watch how local people shop and what for. Our driver was stunned when he showed me the huge baskets full of oysters and I told him how much oysters can cost back home.

title: Authentic Gambia
text: This local market you have to see. You really get a glimpse of the locals' everyday life. Take a local guide with you.

title: Rynek
text: Super klimaty. Kolor, różnorodność,  zdziwienie 😲,  zapach. Nie za bardzo handlujący lubią gdy się ich fotografuje ;-) Kup coś a zrobisz świetne zdjęcie.

title: Good Market!
text: We went as a group and this market was a good market! Good prices (that you barter for) good variety of stalls and the locals are all very nice! We were stuck between going to this Market and the Serekunda Market but we decided on this one! Not sure what the Serekunda Market is like but this one was great for what we needed!

title: albert markt bezoeken
text: aparte markt, met een te hoge vraagprijs, een derde hiervan is normale prijs. Ga hier geen eten kopen, mooie soeveniers

title: Visit if it is the only market you have a chance to see
text: The area is alive with people, smells, and life.  I come to just walk through the area and ignore the vendors trying to sell most anything you can think of.  Having a local guide is helpful to guide you through the maize of paths.  Guides often help keep the people from hassling you.  While the meat and fish area may be smelly and upsetting for some, it is worth a visit.  This is one area in the country I had to be careful with taking photos.  The other side of the market opens to the beach area where you can see the larger boats and small boats unloading what they have brought in.  The market is Banjul at work!

title: erg gezellige sferr
text: Geweldige markt om eens te bezoeken , alle kleuren en vers fruit heerlijk, ook zie je dingen die hier echt niet kunnen, maar daarvoor ben je in Afrika en niet in nederland

title: Marker....
text: Plac targowy na którym można wiele kupić, dużo sprzedawców bardzo zachęcających do kupienia ich towaru ufff bardzo męczące :-)

title: a real eye opener
text: lots of hustle and bustle very vibrant great fun haggling for goods that you buy (please haggle because the trader love this and treat it like a game) many bargains to be had. i would advise you to miss the fish and meat market section it really stinks and swarms of fly but other then that was great fun

title: An explosion on the senses
text:
Go to the food market early in the morning (i think it opens at 8): everyone is too busy to bother with you, so for a brief time you'll be ignored and free to pass through unmolested and without being stopped by hawkers. The temperature is also much more tolerable at that time, and there are no other tourists. 
The sights and smells are not altogether pleasant, but a great taste of africa!

title: A real eye opener
text: A very interesting morning seeing different crafts and an insight into the daily life of the locals.Watched all the fish coming off the boats before being taken to the market to be sold.

title: Compras de ultima hora
text: Voy cada año a Gambia, y visito este mercado siempre los últimos días para darme una vuelta y hacer alguna vompra de última hora... La zona del mercado mas turística, mejor no la pises si no quieres comprar... Como en casi todos los mercados para "guiris" te dicen que sólo mires y acabas comprando... Jeje

title: Dit mag je niet missen
text:
Druk, maar gezellig. Onoverzichtelijk, maar leuk.
De markt die je gezien moet hebben opgesplitst in 3 delen, de locale markt, de toeristische markt en de groente en fruit markt.  Leuk om te zien en als je iets wilt moet je goed kunnen onderhandelen, anders betaal je teveel. Zonder gids ben je verloren,  maar als je uit de taxi stapt staan er al mensen klaar om je rond te leiden.

title: Interesting place to see
text: The craft market is very interesting and has amazing handicrafts. Always remember to bargain! The sellers are trying to get visitors' attention all the time, which is somewhat annoying. Having a local with you might help as he can show around but it doesn't help with noisy sellers.

title: not very interesting
text: A lot of standard tourist nic nacs and every man/woman tries to get you in his job. At the entrance you've a few fruit stalls with really nice ladies working there, without the aggressive approach.

title: Leuk klein lokaal marktje
text:
De moeite waard om even over het marktje te lopen, allerlei toeristische dingen te koop, en vriendelijke verkopers.
Bij de ingang staat een klein winkeltje ( mama africa) hier zit een lief oud vrouwtje die oa sigaretten verkoop tegen normale prijzen.

title: Mooi materiaal maar zeer opdringerig
text: Je vindt er alles om met een leuk souvenir naar huis te gaan maar zeker afdingen want hun prijzen swingen de pan uit !

title: Please visit !
text: You can get all your need here ..Try  to be fair and not to beat their price down to much ! These peoples work hard all day  making there goods They need your support !

title: Типичный туристический рынок
text: Хороший рынок с большим выбором туристических сувениров. Начальные цены достаточно высокие, поэтому обязательно нужно торговаться. Можно купить неплохие поделки местных жителей.

title: Mooie spullen
text: Deze zat bij onze 2-daagse tour door de binnenlanden van Gambia. Erg opdringerig, maar gewoon aangeven dat je komt om te kijken. Als je wat wil kopen, rekenen ze Toubab prijzen, voorbeeldje. Een kom en een schaal vragen ze 1700 dal. voor, dan is het meest handige om bv 100 te bieden. Veel te laag.. uiteindelijk zal je op een paar honderd uitkomen 700. VOnd ik een prima prijs.

title: Mercado de souvenirs
text:
Es un mercado chiquitillo en el que venden en casi todos los puestos lo mismo. Figuras de madera de diferentes tamaños, timbales, collares, pulseras, etc...
Si os gusta el regateo puede ser entretenido, puedes comprar cosas a muy buen precio.
Si solo quereis daros una vuelta y no comprar nada es mejor k no os acerqueis a mirar nada porque te lo intentaran vender SI o SI.
Son bastante insistentes.

title: Running the gauntlet
text: I love this craft market but it is not for the faint-hearted.  If you love to barter, don't mind a bit of hassle as you try to find what you are looking for, then you could really enjoy yourself here. Nice little local café at the entrance where for just a little money you can sample the local food, fresh fruit and cold drinks available too at the entrance.  My advice here is to keep your sense of humour, don't get dragged inside the stalls as you WILL not get out without buying something you may not want, but enjoy the fun, the bartering and the genuine openness of the lovely Gambian people. They are trying to earn a living, if you respect them, they will respect you.  Never pay the asking price, it will usually be at least double what they expect you to pay! Fabulous clothes and jewellery and lots of wonderful wooden artefacts to take home as souvenirs. There are even tailors who will whip up an outfit for you in very little time for very fair prices.  Happy shopping and smile!

title: Great experience
text: Always worth a visit when staying in Kololi. If in doubt take an official guide with you. Excellent value. They really know their stuff and will help you with any haggling, language difficulties etc.

title: market day
text: i went to the market every time i went to gambia great experience but keep in mind you will get pulled in every stall and they think you should buy from everyone you have to be harsh and say no a lot and only pay half of what they ask or less and be willing to walk away go back the next day and you will get a good deal

title: Great for souvenirs
text: Great market for souvenirs! The stall owners can be pushy, but remember you don't have to buy everything they ask you too!

title: Great shopping
text: Barta everyone sells similar things.. Material heaven bangles jewellery and ornaments, a must visit for all

title: Souvenir heaven
text: It's a nice market if you want to buy some souvenirs for the people at home. Everybody wants to sell so don't be intimidated by them.  I had a jumpsuit made by hand and I love it!

title: nice items
text: was an experience, was quiet at this time of year, you do get hassled but think thats part of the experience.

title: Good for some souvenirs
text: This is a very small craft market in the strip, where you can buy some souvenirs and you don't have to suffer the terrible smell of bigger markets such as the one in Banjul. Ready yourself for sellers telling you to stop at their stall constantly and some haggling.  It opens around 10 am and opens around 8 pm.

title: Nothing out of the ordinary.
text: Lots of beads, clothing, beachwear, trinkets, wooden articles all rough hewn, nothing much to catch my eye and a bit too pushy stall vendors for my liking.

title: Great   shopping  a  must,
text:
A  must,  great  place  a  bit  rough  under  foot  in  places but  the  people    selling  do  bother  you  a bit
but  a  polite  no  thanks  does  the  job,  I  just  love  the  atmosphere  with  the  bartering  to  get  bargins   I  will
be  back in  November  2015   and  back  to  the  market,

title: A good place to buy pressies for friends back home
text:
However, it can be a bit too pushy for you to buy something.  I wish the traders would back off and just let you have a good browse, take it in and buy what you want.  

However, not a bad place to be.

title: Opdringerig...druk
text:
Nooit meer!!!!
Hele nare ervaring. Echter:
Het is een Gambia-ervaring en beleving vanuit mijn ervaring. Ik was hier samen met een goede vriendin. Algeheel verblijf was een drama. Nooit rust vanwege opdringerigheid.  Ik heb geleerd mezelf voortaan altijd in te lezen voordat ik een reis boek. Tip: nooit als vrouwen alleen op stap gaan naar deze markt, tenzij je er bekend bent.

title: Very nice place
text:
A very nice and friendly place. Lots of excellent crafts and good prices. 
Friendly people.
Recommended for everyone.

title: Really local market
text: Small streets. Many choises. It is best to have someone local with you. You can loose your directions. Worth to see. It shows Gambling.

title: A highlight of you visit to Banjul
text: As above a highlight to your visit to Banjul , Been several times , just back JAN 16 ,, originally went with a Juice Boys from the Lacio as can be a bit daunting if never been before , however now visit un escorted ( they seem to know if you have been before ) and just a polite no will do . so deff give a visit it is a eye opening experience

title: Intressant
text: Intressant men något jobbigt, när alla säljare drar  i en och vill sälja sina saker. När vi är fyra i familjen var det lite svårt att hålla ihop.

title: Kleurrijk
text: Harstikke leuke drukke echt hectische markt. Ook heel kleurrijk alle groente word hier verkocht meestal zitten ze op de grond tussen de vis die er ok ligt....heel gezellig ook

title: Go early before it's too budy
text: This is a lively market used by locals, there was lots of food and flies, boys operating sewing machines as fast as lightening, many examples of local crafts, a guide of your choosing saves the hassle of being followed around by an opportunist who will want money for guiding you, we used the taxi driver, not really big enough to get seriously lost though, everyone wants you to look at their stall, bartering essential!

title: Pruta!!
text:
Kul marknad med massor av olika saker att titta på.
Pruta minst 50 % om du ska köpa något.
Det kan kännas lite jobbigt när alla försäljare sliter och drar i dig dock.

title: Go with a Local
text: When we arrived at Albert Market we were already with a friend, but another "market guide" came up and offered to show us around as well. It was helpful having others that know good prices as they helped us bargain. The craft vendors especially will try to get the best of you and are much more aggressive than the other vendors. Be firm in your prices; they may try and tell you that they're losing money if they give it to you for the price you've suggested but of course it isn't true. For a small wooden figurine or a flashy beaded necklace for example, 100 Dalasi each is sufficient. For a beach wrap, expect to pay approximately 200 Dalasi. At the end of our market excursion our market guide asked us for some money to buy a drink with, so expect to tip if you allow his services.

title: Gezellig drukte
text: een bezoekje aan de Albert Market is zeker de moeite waard voor iedereen die er nog nooit is geweest. Advies is wel om met een gids te gaan.

title: Almost a must
text: In Gambia you of course should visit a market. This one is big, a bit touristy but not too obtrusive. If you're prepared for a more genuine market (almost no tourists, smells, dirt, atmosphere!) go to Serrekunta...

title: Dip yourself in African smells and colours
text: Great place to taste Gambian folklore at its pure, harsh version. Especially worth visiting is its handicraft sector.

title: Dit moet je zeker hebben gezien!!!
text: Wij zijn op de Albert Market geweest en hebben er echt  in volle teugen van genoten. Als je de tijd neemt, zie je hier echt van alles. Ze verkopen hier groente, fruit, vlees, vis, stof, huishoudwaren, schoenen, heel veel van hout - gewoon te veel om op te noemen. Het is zeker de moeite waard om hier een keer rustig over heen te lopen. Neem in ieder geval een gids mee, wij waren hier de enige "Toubabs" (witte europeaan) en dat voelt zonder begeleiding niet echt prettig, Als je foto's wilt maken worden ze vaak boos. Dit wordt niet op prijs gesteld omdat ze denken dat de foto's verkocht worden. Naar enig uitleg mag het gelukkig wel. Albert Market moet je volgens ons echt gezien hebben als je in Gambia op vakantie bent.

title: not as crazy as Serekunda market!
text: Albert market caters for tourists and visitors more than the huge and bustling Serekunda market, but there is plenty to see and smell as locals go about their lives and the place is full of jostle and banter

title: Van alles te zien
text: Ga met een gids anders verdwaal je. Geen foto's maken zonder toestemming. Onderhandelen tot je er bij neervalt.

title: Not for the Fainthearted
text:
I had fun at this market, which is actually called Albert Market. It is not the usual kind of fun and you need to understand that it can be full of people on some days. Also understand that depending on where you go in the market, there can be strong smells of fish and meat, with flies in abundance sitting on the fish mainly. The market feels a little chaotic but if you go with someone who knows it, it is not bad. Do not expect to be wowed with amazing arts and crafts. This is a true third world market and some of the streets you might walk through are muddy with stones and holes randomly distributed. If you know where to go, you can also see a beach close to the market where boats arrive to sell their fish first to people waiting on the beach. You will also be able to see from this beach where the Atlantic Ocean and the Gambia River meet.

If you are not sure if this market is for you, ask yourself if you have seen a few third world countries and markets before. If you have, it should not phaze you. However, if this is your first experience of a third world country, it might come as a complete and overwhelming culture shock to you. Perhaps ask a taxi driver to walk with you and, if you feel you want to get out of there, you can then let the driver know. At least that way you have a quick escape.

title: Good market to visit
text: A better market than Serrecunda, not so much pressure or crowds, lovely to see all the colours and to smell all the different smells, and good to have a good barter for something.

title: Be brave.....
text:
dear traveller.  Be brave.

The sights, the sounds, the smells can all be over-whelming and the hangers-on (bumsters in the local parlance) who will magically appear, can be a total pain in the posterior --- but be brave.

Grit your teeth, ignore the bumsters, and go your own way, and you won't be disappointed.........  but time it right. To do the market justice you must allow 2 to 3+ hours and in the heat it can get stifling, so time your visit for either very early in the morning or the late afternoon, and don't forget your water!

title: 신기한 볼거리 가득
text: 직모를 가지고 싶어하는 아프리카 사람들의 심리로, 가발이 많이 진열되어 있어요^^ 고소한 견과류와 함께 둘러보면 좋아요~

title: Go here if you are brave
text: The smells are overwhelming here. Very lively place to see plenty of things you could buy, if you would live a life here in Banjul.

title: Banjul Market
text: the market is an eye opener - but do not go with out a guide!!   you will just get hassled from the bumsters.   we brought some wooden carvings - but remember to haggle, do no pay the price asked.   its a very different world out there but the people are lovely

title: Een gezellige markt met liefdevolle mensen
text:
Deze markt is een aanwinst in het dorp, fruit, kleding, sieraden en schilderijtjes die daar ter plekke worden gemaakt. Naaisters die druk bezig zijn om de mooiste jurken, blouses te maken. Zelf heb ik een mooi tweedelig pak laten maken van satijnen stof.
Een blouse met een rok. Ontzettend blij mee. De mensen zijn zo ontzettend vriendelijk.
Neem wel een gids van het hotel mee. Er zijn ook wel eens opdringerige mensen. Met de gids heb je daar geen last van.

title: Weniger als erwartet
text: Der Crocodile Pool wird groß angeboten. Es handelt sich tatsächlich nur um einen Pool und ist eigentlich in 10 min abgehakt. Krokodile gibt es allerdings reichlich. Es wird ein Trinkgeld zusätzlich zum Eintritt erwartet.

title: Krokodillen aaien
text: De entreeprijs is 100 Gambiaanse foppen. Het museum over de Gambiaanse geschiedenis is modern en steekt het Nationaal Museum naar de kroon (al is dat niet zo moeilijk). De krokodillen, zo’n 70 exemplaren, leven al heel lang rondom dit meertje. De populatie houdt zichzelf in stand door niet erg groot te worden en door middelen van geboortebeperking. Zouden mensen ook eens moeten doen. Aanraken van de krokodillen mag. Af en toe hapt er een geïrriteerd naar je, maar de meeste krokodillen liggen vooral bij te tanken.

title: Vies water en klein
text:
Op voorhand hadden we enige twijfels om hier naartoe te gaan, uiteindelijk hebben we het toch maar gedaan.
Het is laagdrempelig en goedkoop, maar het is wel gewoon een 'vies watertje' met veel te veel krokodillen. Dat kan vast niet goed zijn. Niet een must om naartoe te gaan.

title: Sorprende cocodrilos sueltos, hay museo con explicaciones de tradiciones
text: Dicen que no atacan porque sólo comen pescado, mi teoria es que no atacan porque les dan de comer cada día. Di una propina para que compren comida

title: Wie so oft ist der Weg das Ziel.
text:
Wenn man die Tour selber macht. 
Nehmt euch ein SUV .
Die " Straßen" sind sonst kaum befahrbar.
